          1
          
            class ProtoServerError       < ProtocolError; end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1
          
            class ProtoAuthError         < ProtocolError; end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          1
          
            class ProtoCommandError      < ProtocolError; end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
            class ProtoRetriableError    < ProtocolError; end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          1
          
            ProtocRetryError = ProtoRetriableError
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            ##
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # OpenTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a connection cannot
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # be created within the open_timeout.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
            class OpenTimeout            < Timeout::Error; end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            ##
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            # ReadTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a chunk of the
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # response cannot be read within the read_timeout.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          1
          
            class ReadTimeout < Timeout::Error
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io = nil)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                @io = io
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
              end
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
              def message
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                msg = super
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                if @io
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                  msg = "#{msg} with #{@io.inspect}"
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                msg
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
              end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            ##
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            # WriteTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a chunk of the
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            # response cannot be written within the write_timeout.  Not raised on Windows.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
            class WriteTimeout < Timeout::Error
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io = nil)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                @io = io
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
              def message
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                msg = super
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                if @io
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  msg = "#{msg} with #{@io.inspect}"
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                msg
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
            class BufferedIO   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io, read_timeout: 60, write_timeout: 60, continue_timeout: nil, debug_output: nil)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          57
          
                @io = io
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          57
          
                @read_timeout = read_timeout
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          57
          
                @write_timeout = write_timeout
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          57
          
                @continue_timeout = continue_timeout
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          57
          
                @debug_output = debug_output
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          57
          
                @rbuf = ''.b
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
              end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :read_timeout
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :write_timeout
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :continue_timeout
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :debug_output
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class} io=#{@io}>"
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          1
          
              def eof?
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                @io.eof?
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              end
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          1
          
              def closed?
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          171
          
                @io.closed?
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
              end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          1
          
              def close
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          114
          
                @io.close
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              #
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              # Read
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
              #
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
              public
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          1
          
              def read(len, dest = ''.b, ignore_eof = false)
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                LOG "reading #{len} bytes..."
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                begin
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  while read_bytes + @rbuf.size < len
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    s = rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    read_bytes += s.size
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                    dest << s
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                  s = rbuf_consume(len - read_bytes)
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  read_bytes += s.size
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                  dest << s
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  raise unless ignore_eof
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                LOG "read #{read_bytes} bytes"
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                dest
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
              def read_all(dest = ''.b)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          57
          
                LOG 'reading all...'
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          57
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                begin
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          57
          
                  while true
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          71
          
                    s = rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          71
          
                    read_bytes += s.size
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          71
          
                    dest << s
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          71
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  ;
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          57
          
                LOG "read #{read_bytes} bytes"
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          57
          
                dest
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
              def readuntil(terminator, ignore_eof = false)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                begin
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          285
          
                  until idx = @rbuf.index(terminator)
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          57
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                  end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          285
          
                  return rbuf_consume(idx + terminator.size)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                  raise unless ignore_eof
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                  return rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                end
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
          
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          1
          
              def readline
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          57
          
                readuntil("\n").chop
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          1
          
              private
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
              BUFSIZE = 1024 * 16
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          1
          
              def rbuf_fill
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          128
          
                tmp = @rbuf.empty? ? @rbuf : nil
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          128
          
                case rv = @io.read_nonblock(BUFSIZE, tmp, exception: false)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                when String
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          71
          
                  return if rv.equal?(tmp)
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                  @rbuf << rv
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                  rv.clear
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                  return
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                when :wait_readable
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          56
          
                  (io = @io.to_io).wait_readable(@read_timeout) or raise Net::ReadTimeout.new(io)
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  # continue looping
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                when :wait_writable
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  # OpenSSL::Buffering#read_nonblock may fail with IO::WaitWritable.
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  # http://www.openssl.org/support/faq.html#PROG10
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                  (io = @io.to_io).wait_writable(@read_timeout) or raise Net::ReadTimeout.new(io)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  # continue looping
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                when nil
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          57
          
                  raise EOFError, 'end of file reached'
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                end while true
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              end
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
          
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          1
          
              def rbuf_consume(len)
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          356
          
                if len == @rbuf.size
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          71
          
                  s = @rbuf
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          71
          
                  @rbuf = ''.b
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                else
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          285
          
                  s = @rbuf.slice!(0, len)
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          356
          
                @debug_output << %Q[-> #{s.dump}\n] if @debug_output
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          356
          
                s
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              end
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              # Write
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          1
          
              public
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          1
          
              def write(*strs)
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          114
          
                writing {
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          114
          
                  write0(*strs)
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                }
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          1
          
              alias << write
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          1
          
              def writeline(str)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                writing {
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                  write0 str + "\r\n"
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                }
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
              end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
          
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          1
          
              private
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          1
          
              def writing
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          114
          
                @written_bytes = 0
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          114
          
                @debug_output << '<- ' if @debug_output
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          114
          
                yield
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          114
          
                @debug_output << "\n" if @debug_output
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          114
          
                bytes = @written_bytes
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          114
          
                @written_bytes = nil
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          114
          
                bytes
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1
          
              def write0(*strs)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          114
          
                @debug_output << strs.map(&:dump).join if @debug_output
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          114
          
                orig_written_bytes = @written_bytes
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          114
          
                strs.each_with_index do |str, i|
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          114
          
                  need_retry = true
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          114
          
                  case len = @io.write_nonblock(str, exception: false)
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  when Integer
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          117
          
                    @written_bytes += len
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          117
          
                    len -= str.bytesize
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          117
          
                    if len == 0
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          114
          
                      if strs.size == i+1
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          114
          
                        return @written_bytes - orig_written_bytes
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                      else
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                        need_retry = false
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                        # next string
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                      end
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          3
          
                    elsif len < 0
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          3
          
                      str = str.byteslice(len, -len)
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                    else # len > 0
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                      need_retry = false
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                      # next string
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                    end
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                    # continue looping
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                  when :wait_writable
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                    (io = @io.to_io).wait_writable(@write_timeout) or raise Net::WriteTimeout.new(io)
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                    # continue looping
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                  end while need_retry
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                end
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
              end
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              #
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              # Logging
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          1
          
              private
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          1
          
              def LOG_off
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                @save_debug_out = @debug_output
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                @debug_output = nil
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              end
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
          
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          1
          
              def LOG_on
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                @debug_output = @save_debug_out
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
              end
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          1
          
              def LOG(msg)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          114
          
                return unless @debug_output
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                @debug_output << msg + "\n"
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
              end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
            end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          1
          
            class InternetMessageIO < BufferedIO   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          1
          
              def initialize(*)
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                super
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                @wbuf = nil
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              end
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
          
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              #
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              # Read
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              #
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
          
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          1
          
              def each_message_chunk
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                LOG 'reading message...'
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                while (line = readuntil("\r\n")) != ".\r\n"
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  read_bytes += line.size
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                  yield line.delete_prefix('.')
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                LOG "read message (#{read_bytes} bytes)"
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              # *library private* (cannot handle 'break')
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
              def each_list_item
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                while (str = readuntil("\r\n")) != ".\r\n"
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                  yield str.chop
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
          
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          1
          
              def write_message_0(src)
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                prev = @written_bytes
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                each_crlf_line(src) do |line|
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                  write0 dot_stuff(line)
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                end
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                @written_bytes - prev
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              #
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              # Write
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              #
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
          
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          1
          
              def write_message(src)
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                LOG "writing message from #{src.class}"
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                len = writing {
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                  using_each_crlf_line {
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
                    write_message_0 src
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                  }
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
                }
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
                LOG "wrote #{len} bytes"
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                len
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              end
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
          
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          1
          
              def write_message_by_block(&block)
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                LOG 'writing message from block'
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                len = writing {
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                  using_each_crlf_line {
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                      block.call(WriteAdapter.new(self, :write_message_0))
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                    rescue LocalJumpError
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                      # allow `break' from writer block
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                    end
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                  }
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                }
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                LOG "wrote #{len} bytes"
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                len
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              end
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          1
          
              private
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
          
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          1
          
              def dot_stuff(s)
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                s.sub(/\A\./, '..')
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              end
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
          
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          1
          
              def using_each_crlf_line
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                @wbuf = ''.b
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                yield
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                if not @wbuf.empty?   # unterminated last line
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                  write0 dot_stuff(@wbuf.chomp) + "\r\n"
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                elsif @written_bytes == 0   # empty src
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                  write0 "\r\n"
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                end
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                write0 ".\r\n"
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                @wbuf = nil
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
              end
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          1
          
              def each_crlf_line(src)
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                buffer_filling(@wbuf, src) do
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  while line = @wbuf.slice!(/\A[^\r\n]*(?:\n|\r(?:\n|(?!\z)))/)
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
                    yield line.chomp("\n") + "\r\n"
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                  end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
                end
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              end
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
          
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          1
          
              def buffer_filling(buf, src)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                case src
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
                when String    # for speeding up.
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
                  0.step(src.size - 1, 1024) do |i|
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
                    buf << src[i, 1024]
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                  end
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
                when File    # for speeding up.
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                  while s = src.read(1024)
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
                    buf << s
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
                  end
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
                else    # generic reader
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
                  src.each do |str|
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
                    buf << str
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                    yield if buf.size > 1024
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                  end
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  yield unless buf.empty?
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                end
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
              end
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
            end
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
          
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            #
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            # The writer adapter class
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            #
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          1
          
            class WriteAdapter
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          1
          
              def initialize(socket, method)
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
                @socket = socket
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                @method_id = method
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
              end
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class} socket=#{@socket.inspect}>"
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              end
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
          
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          1
          
              def write(str)
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                @socket.__send__(@method_id, str)
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              end
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
          
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          1
          
              alias print write
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
          
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          1
          
              def <<(str)
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
                write str
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                self
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
              end
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
          
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          1
          
              def puts(str = '')
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
                write str.chomp("\n") + "\n"
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
              end
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          1
          
              def printf(*args)
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
                write sprintf(*args)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
              end
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            end
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
          
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
          
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          1
          
            class ReadAdapter   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          1
          
              def initialize(block)
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                @block = block
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
              end
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
          
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class}>"
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
              end
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
          
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          1
          
              def <<(str)
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                call_block(str, &@block) if @block
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
              end
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
          
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          1
          
              private
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
          
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
              # This method is needed because @block must be called by yield,
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
              # not Proc#call.  You can see difference when using `break' in
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
              # the block.
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          1
          
              def call_block(str)
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
                yield str
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
              end
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
            end
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
          
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
          
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          1
          
            module NetPrivate   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          1
          
              Socket = ::Net::InternetMessageIO
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
            end
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
          
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
          end   # module Net
        
      507.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/optparse.rb

    45.77 % covered

    721 relevant lines. 330 lines covered and 391 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # optparse.rb - command-line option analysis with the OptionParser class.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # Author:: Nobu Nakada
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # Documentation:: Nobu Nakada and Gavin Sinclair.
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # See OptionParser for documentation.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #--
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # == Developer Documentation (not for RDoc output)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # === Class tree
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser:: front end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::Switch:: each switches
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::List:: options list
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::ParseError:: errors on parsing
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::AmbiguousOption
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::NeedlessArgument
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::MissingArgument
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::InvalidOption
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::InvalidArgument
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #     - OptionParser::AmbiguousArgument
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          #
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          # === Object relationship diagram
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          #
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #   +--------------+
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #   | OptionParser |<>-----+
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #   +--------------+       |                      +--------+
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          #                          |                    ,-| Switch |
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #        on_head -------->+---------------+    /  +--------+
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          #        accept/reject -->| List          |<|>-
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #                         |               |<|>-  +----------+
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          #        on ------------->+---------------+    `-| argument |
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          #                           :           :        |  class   |
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          #                         +---------------+      |==========|
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          #        on_tail -------->|               |      |pattern   |
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          #                         +---------------+      |----------|
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          #   OptionParser.accept ->| DefaultList   |      |converter |
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          #                reject   |(shared between|      +----------+
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          #                         | all instances)|
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          #                         +---------------+
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          #++
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          #
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          # == OptionParser
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          # === Introduction
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          # OptionParser is a class for command-line option analysis.  It is much more
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          # advanced, yet also easier to use, than GetoptLong, and is a more Ruby-oriented
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          # solution.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          # === Features
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          #
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          # 1. The argument specification and the code to handle it are written in the
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          #    same place.
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          # 2. It can output an option summary; you don't need to maintain this string
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
          #    separately.
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          # 3. Optional and mandatory arguments are specified very gracefully.
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          # 4. Arguments can be automatically converted to a specified class.
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          # 5. Arguments can be restricted to a certain set.
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          #
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          # All of these features are demonstrated in the examples below.  See
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
          # #make_switch for full documentation.
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
          #
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          # === Minimal example
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          #
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          #
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          #   options = {}
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          #   OptionParser.new do |opts|
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          #     opts.banner = "Usage: example.rb [options]"
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          #     opts.on("-v", "--[no-]verbose", "Run verbosely") do |v|
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          #       options[:verbose] = v
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          #   end.parse!
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          #
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          #   p options
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
          #   p ARGV
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          #
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
          # === Generating Help
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          #
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          # OptionParser can be used to automatically generate help for the commands you
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          # write:
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          #
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          #
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          #   Options = Struct.new(:name)
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          #   class Parser
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          #     def self.parse(options)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
          #       args = Options.new("world")
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
          #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
          #       opt_parser = OptionParser.new do |opts|
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          #         opts.banner = "Usage: example.rb [options]"
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          #
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          #         opts.on("-nNAME", "--name=NAME", "Name to say hello to") do |n|
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          #           args.name = n
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          #         end
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          #
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          #         opts.on("-h", "--help", "Prints this help") do
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          #           puts opts
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
          #           exit
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          #         end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          #       end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          #
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          #       opt_parser.parse!(options)
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
          #       return args
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          #   options = Parser.parse %w[--help]
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          #
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          #   #=>
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          #      # Usage: example.rb [options]
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          #      #     -n, --name=NAME                  Name to say hello to
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
          #      #     -h, --help                       Prints this help
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          #
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
          # === Required Arguments
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
          #
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
          # For options that require an argument, option specification strings may include an
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          # option name in all caps. If an option is used without the required argument,
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          # an exception will be raised.
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          #
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          #
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          #   options = {}
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          #   OptionParser.new do |parser|
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
          #     parser.on("-r", "--require LIBRARY",
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          #               "Require the LIBRARY before executing your script") do |lib|
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
          #       puts "You required #{lib}!"
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          #   end.parse!
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          #
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          # Used:
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          #
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb -r
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          #   optparse-test.rb:9:in `<main>': missing argument: -r (OptionParser::MissingArgument)
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb -r my-library
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          #   You required my-library!
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          #
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          # === Type Coercion
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          #
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          # OptionParser supports the ability to coerce command line arguments
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
          # into objects for us.
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          # OptionParser comes with a few ready-to-use kinds of  type
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          # coercion. They are:
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          #
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
          # - Date  -- Anything accepted by +Date.parse+
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          # - DateTime -- Anything accepted by +DateTime.parse+
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          # - Time -- Anything accepted by +Time.httpdate+ or +Time.parse+
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          # - URI  -- Anything accepted by +URI.parse+
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          # - Shellwords -- Anything accepted by +Shellwords.shellwords+
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          # - String -- Any non-empty string
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
          # - Integer -- Any integer. Will convert octal. (e.g. 124, -3, 040)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          # - Float -- Any float. (e.g. 10, 3.14, -100E+13)
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          # - Numeric -- Any integer, float, or rational (1, 3.4, 1/3)
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          # - DecimalInteger -- Like +Integer+, but no octal format.
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          # - OctalInteger -- Like +Integer+, but no decimal format.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
          # - DecimalNumeric -- Decimal integer or float.
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          # - TrueClass --  Accepts '+, yes, true, -, no, false' and
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          #   defaults as +true+
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
          # - FalseClass -- Same as +TrueClass+, but defaults to +false+
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
          # - Array -- Strings separated by ',' (e.g. 1,2,3)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          # - Regexp -- Regular expressions. Also includes options.
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          #
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
          # We can also add our own coercions, which we will cover soon.
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          # ==== Using Built-in Conversions
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          #
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          # As an example, the built-in +Time+ conversion is used. The other built-in
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          # conversions behave in the same way.
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          # OptionParser will attempt to parse the argument
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
          # as a +Time+. If it succeeds, that time will be passed to the
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          # handler block. Otherwise, an exception will be raised.
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          #
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse/time'
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
          #   OptionParser.new do |parser|
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          #     parser.on("-t", "--time [TIME]", Time, "Begin execution at given time") do |time|
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          #       p time
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          #   end.parse!
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          #
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          # Used:
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          #
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb  -t nonsense
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          #   ... invalid argument: -t nonsense (OptionParser::InvalidArgument)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb  -t 10-11-12
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          #   2010-11-12 00:00:00 -0500
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb  -t 9:30
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
          #   2014-08-13 09:30:00 -0400
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
          #
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
          # ==== Creating Custom Conversions
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          #
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          # The +accept+ method on OptionParser may be used to create converters.
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          # It specifies which conversion block to call whenever a class is specified.
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          # The example below uses it to fetch a +User+ object before the +on+ handler receives it.
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
          #
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
          #
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          #   User = Struct.new(:id, :name)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
          #
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          #   def find_user id
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
          #     not_found = ->{ raise "No User Found for id #{id}" }
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          #     [ User.new(1, "Sam"),
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
          #       User.new(2, "Gandalf") ].find(not_found) do |u|
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
          #       u.id == id
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          #
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          #   op = OptionParser.new
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
          #   op.accept(User) do |user_id|
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          #     find_user user_id.to_i
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          #
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
          #   op.on("--user ID", User) do |user|
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          #     puts user
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
          #
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          #   op.parse!
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          #
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
          # Used:
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          #
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb --user 1
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          #   #<struct User id=1, name="Sam">
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb --user 2
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          #   #<struct User id=2, name="Gandalf">
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb --user 3
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
          #   optparse-test.rb:15:in `block in find_user': No User Found for id 3 (RuntimeError)
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
          #
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          # === Store options to a Hash
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          #
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          # The +into+ option of +order+, +parse+ and so on methods stores command line options into a Hash.
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
          #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          #   params = {}
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
          #   OptionParser.new do |opts|
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          #     opts.on('-a')
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
          #     opts.on('-b NUM', Integer)
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
          #     opts.on('-v', '--verbose')
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
          #   end.parse!(into: params)
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          #
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
          #   p params
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          #
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
          # Used:
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          #
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb -a
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          #   {:a=>true}
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb -a -v
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
          #   {:a=>true, :verbose=>true}
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
          #   $ ruby optparse-test.rb -a -b 100
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
          #   {:a=>true, :b=>100}
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
          #
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          # === Complete example
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          #
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
          # The following example is a complete Ruby program.  You can run it and see the
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
          # effect of specifying various options.  This is probably the best way to learn
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
          # the features of +optparse+.
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
          #
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse'
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
          #   require 'optparse/time'
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
          #   require 'ostruct'
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          #   require 'pp'
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          #
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
          #   class OptparseExample
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          #     Version = '1.0.0'
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
          #
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          #     CODES = %w[iso-2022-jp shift_jis euc-jp utf8 binary]
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
          #     CODE_ALIASES = { "jis" => "iso-2022-jp", "sjis" => "shift_jis" }
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
          #
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
          #     class ScriptOptions
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
          #       attr_accessor :library, :inplace, :encoding, :transfer_type,
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
          #                     :verbose, :extension, :delay, :time, :record_separator,
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          #                     :list
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
          #
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
          #       def initialize
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
          #         self.library = []
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
          #         self.inplace = false
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
          #         self.encoding = "utf8"
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
          #         self.transfer_type = :auto
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
          #         self.verbose = false
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
          #       end
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          #
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
          #       def define_options(parser)
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
          #         parser.banner = "Usage: example.rb [options]"
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
          #         parser.separator ""
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
          #         parser.separator "Specific options:"
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
          #
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
          #         # add additional options
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
          #         perform_inplace_option(parser)
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
          #         delay_execution_option(parser)
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
          #         execute_at_time_option(parser)
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          #         specify_record_separator_option(parser)
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          #         list_example_option(parser)
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
          #         specify_encoding_option(parser)
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
          #         optional_option_argument_with_keyword_completion_option(parser)
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          #         boolean_verbose_option(parser)
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          #
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
          #         parser.separator ""
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          #         parser.separator "Common options:"
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
          #         # No argument, shows at tail.  This will print an options summary.
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
          #         # Try it and see!
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          #         parser.on_tail("-h", "--help", "Show this message") do
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
          #           puts parser
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
          #           exit
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
          #         end
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
          #         # Another typical switch to print the version.
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
          #         parser.on_tail("--version", "Show version") do
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          #           puts Version
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
          #           exit
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
          #         end
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
          #       end
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
          #
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
          #       def perform_inplace_option(parser)
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          #         # Specifies an optional option argument
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          #         parser.on("-i", "--inplace [EXTENSION]",
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
          #                   "Edit ARGV files in place",
        
      325. 
      
        
    325.
