                filename ||= File.expand_path(File.basename($0, '.*'), '~/.options')
        
      1814. 
      
        
    1814. 
          
          
              rescue
        
      1815. 
      
        
    1815. 
          
          
                return false
        
      1816. 
      
        
    1816. 
          
          
              end
        
      1817. 
      
        
    1817. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1818. 
      
        
    1818. 
          
          
                parse(*IO.readlines(filename).each {|s| s.chomp!})
        
      1819. 
      
        
    1819. 
          
          
                true
        
      1820. 
      
        
    1820. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::ENOENT, Errno::ENOTDIR
        
      1821. 
      
        
    1821. 
          
          
                false
        
      1822. 
      
        
    1822. 
          
          
              end
        
      1823. 
      
        
    1823. 
          
          
            end
        
      1824. 
      
        
    1824. 
          
          
          
        
      1825. 
      
        
    1825. 
          
          
            #
        
      1826. 
      
        
    1826. 
          
          
            # Parses environment variable +env+ or its uppercase with splitting like a
        
      1827. 
      
        
    1827. 
          
          
            # shell.
        
      1828. 
      
        
    1828. 
          
          
            #
        
      1829. 
      
        
    1829. 
          
          
            # +env+ defaults to the basename of the program.
        
      1830. 
      
        
    1830. 
          
          
            #
        
      1831. 
      
        
    1831. 
          1
          
            def environment(env = File.basename($0, '.*'))
        
      1832. 
      
        
    1832. 
          
          
              env = ENV[env] || ENV[env.upcase] or return
        
      1833. 
      
        
    1833. 
          
          
              require 'shellwords'
        
      1834. 
      
        
    1834. 
          
          
              parse(*Shellwords.shellwords(env))
        
      1835. 
      
        
    1835. 
          
          
            end
        
      1836. 
      
        
    1836. 
          
          
          
        
      1837. 
      
        
    1837. 
          
          
            #
        
      1838. 
      
        
    1838. 
          
          
            # Acceptable argument classes
        
      1839. 
      
        
    1839. 
          
          
            #
        
      1840. 
      
        
    1840. 
          
          
          
        
      1841. 
      
        
    1841. 
          
          
            #
        
      1842. 
      
        
    1842. 
          
          
            # Any string and no conversion. This is fall-back.
        
      1843. 
      
        
    1843. 
          
          
            #
        
      1844. 
      
        
    1844. 
          1
          
            accept(Object) {|s,|s or s.nil?}
        
      1845. 
      
        
    1845. 
          
          
          
        
      1846. 
      
        
    1846. 
          1
          
            accept(NilClass) {|s,|s}
        
      1847. 
      
        
    1847. 
          
          
          
        
      1848. 
      
        
    1848. 
          
          
            #
        
      1849. 
      
        
    1849. 
          
          
            # Any non-empty string, and no conversion.
        
      1850. 
      
        
    1850. 
          
          
            #
        
      1851. 
      
        
    1851. 
          1
          
            accept(String, /.+/m) {|s,*|s}
        
      1852. 
      
        
    1852. 
          
          
          
        
      1853. 
      
        
    1853. 
          
          
            #
        
      1854. 
      
        
    1854. 
          
          
            # Ruby/C-like integer, octal for 0-7 sequence, binary for 0b, hexadecimal
        
      1855. 
      
        
    1855. 
          
          
            # for 0x, and decimal for others; with optional sign prefix. Converts to
        
      1856. 
      
        
    1856. 
          
          
            # Integer.
        
      1857. 
      
        
    1857. 
          
          
            #
        
      1858. 
      
        
    1858. 
          1
          
            decimal = '\d+(?:_\d+)*'
        
      1859. 
      
        
    1859. 
          1
          
            binary = 'b[01]+(?:_[01]+)*'
        
      1860. 
      
        
    1860. 
          1
          
            hex = 'x[\da-f]+(?:_[\da-f]+)*'
        
      1861. 
      
        
    1861. 
          1
          
            octal = "0(?:[0-7]+(?:_[0-7]+)*|#{binary}|#{hex})?"
        
      1862. 
      
        
    1862. 
          1
          
            integer = "#{octal}|#{decimal}"
        
      1863. 
      
        
    1863. 
          
          
          
        
      1864. 
      
        
    1864. 
          1
          
            accept(Integer, %r"\A[-+]?(?:#{integer})\z"io) {|s,|
        
      1865. 
      
        
    1865. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1866. 
      
        
    1866. 
          
          
                Integer(s)
        
      1867. 
      
        
    1867. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1868. 
      
        
    1868. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1869. 
      
        
    1869. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1870. 
      
        
    1870. 
          
          
            }
        
      1871. 
      
        
    1871. 
          
          
          
        
      1872. 
      
        
    1872. 
          
          
            #
        
      1873. 
      
        
    1873. 
          
          
            # Float number format, and converts to Float.
        
      1874. 
      
        
    1874. 
          
          
            #
        
      1875. 
      
        
    1875. 
          1
          
            float = "(?:#{decimal}(?=(.)?)(?:\\.(?:#{decimal})?)?|\\.#{decimal})(?:E[-+]?#{decimal})?"
        
      1876. 
      
        
    1876. 
          1
          
            floatpat = %r"\A[-+]?#{float}\z"io
        
      1877. 
      
        
    1877. 
          1
          
            accept(Float, floatpat) {|s,| s.to_f if s}
        
      1878. 
      
        
    1878. 
          
          
          
        
      1879. 
      
        
    1879. 
          
          
            #
        
      1880. 
      
        
    1880. 
          
          
            # Generic numeric format, converts to Integer for integer format, Float
        
      1881. 
      
        
    1881. 
          
          
            # for float format, and Rational for rational format.
        
      1882. 
      
        
    1882. 
          
          
            #
        
      1883. 
      
        
    1883. 
          1
          
            real = "[-+]?(?:#{octal}|#{float})"
        
      1884. 
      
        
    1884. 
          1
          
            accept(Numeric, /\A(#{real})(?:\/(#{real}))?\z/io) {|s, d, f, n,|
        
      1885. 
      
        
    1885. 
          
          
              if n
        
      1886. 
      
        
    1886. 
          
          
                Rational(d, n)
        
      1887. 
      
        
    1887. 
          
          
              elsif f
        
      1888. 
      
        
    1888. 
          
          
                Float(s)
        
      1889. 
      
        
    1889. 
          
          
              else
        
      1890. 
      
        
    1890. 
          
          
                Integer(s)
        
      1891. 
      
        
    1891. 
          
          
              end
        
      1892. 
      
        
    1892. 
          
          
            }
        
      1893. 
      
        
    1893. 
          
          
          
        
      1894. 
      
        
    1894. 
          
          
            #
        
      1895. 
      
        
    1895. 
          
          
            # Decimal integer format, to be converted to Integer.
        
      1896. 
      
        
    1896. 
          
          
            #
        
      1897. 
      
        
    1897. 
          1
          
            DecimalInteger = /\A[-+]?#{decimal}\z/io
        
      1898. 
      
        
    1898. 
          1
          
            accept(DecimalInteger, DecimalInteger) {|s,|
        
      1899. 
      
        
    1899. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1900. 
      
        
    1900. 
          
          
                Integer(s, 10)
        
      1901. 
      
        
    1901. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1902. 
      
        
    1902. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1903. 
      
        
    1903. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1904. 
      
        
    1904. 
          
          
            }
        
      1905. 
      
        
    1905. 
          
          
          
        
      1906. 
      
        
    1906. 
          
          
            #
        
      1907. 
      
        
    1907. 
          
          
            # Ruby/C like octal/hexadecimal/binary integer format, to be converted to
        
      1908. 
      
        
    1908. 
          
          
            # Integer.
        
      1909. 
      
        
    1909. 
          
          
            #
        
      1910. 
      
        
    1910. 
          1
          
            OctalInteger = /\A[-+]?(?:[0-7]+(?:_[0-7]+)*|0(?:#{binary}|#{hex}))\z/io
        
      1911. 
      
        
    1911. 
          1
          
            accept(OctalInteger, OctalInteger) {|s,|
        
      1912. 
      
        
    1912. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1913. 
      
        
    1913. 
          
          
                Integer(s, 8)
        
      1914. 
      
        
    1914. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1915. 
      
        
    1915. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1916. 
      
        
    1916. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1917. 
      
        
    1917. 
          
          
            }
        
      1918. 
      
        
    1918. 
          
          
          
        
      1919. 
      
        
    1919. 
          
          
            #
        
      1920. 
      
        
    1920. 
          
          
            # Decimal integer/float number format, to be converted to Integer for
        
      1921. 
      
        
    1921. 
          
          
            # integer format, Float for float format.
        
      1922. 
      
        
    1922. 
          
          
            #
        
      1923. 
      
        
    1923. 
          1
          
            DecimalNumeric = floatpat     # decimal integer is allowed as float also.
        
      1924. 
      
        
    1924. 
          1
          
            accept(DecimalNumeric, floatpat) {|s, f|
        
      1925. 
      
        
    1925. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1926. 
      
        
    1926. 
          
          
                if f
        
      1927. 
      
        
    1927. 
          
          
                  Float(s)
        
      1928. 
      
        
    1928. 
          
          
                else
        
      1929. 
      
        
    1929. 
          
          
                  Integer(s)
        
      1930. 
      
        
    1930. 
          
          
                end
        
      1931. 
      
        
    1931. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1932. 
      
        
    1932. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1933. 
      
        
    1933. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1934. 
      
        
    1934. 
          
          
            }
        
      1935. 
      
        
    1935. 
          
          
          
        
      1936. 
      
        
    1936. 
          
          
            #
        
      1937. 
      
        
    1937. 
          
          
            # Boolean switch, which means whether it is present or not, whether it is
        
      1938. 
      
        
    1938. 
          
          
            # absent or not with prefix no-, or it takes an argument
        
      1939. 
      
        
    1939. 
          
          
            # yes/no/true/false/+/-.
        
      1940. 
      
        
    1940. 
          
          
            #
        
      1941. 
      
        
    1941. 
          1
          
            yesno = CompletingHash.new
        
      1942. 
      
        
    1942. 
          4
          
            %w[- no false].each {|el| yesno[el] = false}
        
      1943. 
      
        
    1943. 
          4
          
            %w[+ yes true].each {|el| yesno[el] = true}
        
      1944. 
      
        
    1944. 
          1
          
            yesno['nil'] = false          # should be nil?
        
      1945. 
      
        
    1945. 
          1
          
            accept(TrueClass, yesno) {|arg, val| val == nil or val}
        
      1946. 
      
        
    1946. 
          
          
            #
        
      1947. 
      
        
    1947. 
          
          
            # Similar to TrueClass, but defaults to false.
        
      1948. 
      
        
    1948. 
          
          
            #
        
      1949. 
      
        
    1949. 
          1
          
            accept(FalseClass, yesno) {|arg, val| val != nil and val}
        
      1950. 
      
        
    1950. 
          
          
          
        
      1951. 
      
        
    1951. 
          
          
            #
        
      1952. 
      
        
    1952. 
          
          
            # List of strings separated by ",".
        
      1953. 
      
        
    1953. 
          
          
            #
        
      1954. 
      
        
    1954. 
          1
          
            accept(Array) do |s, |
        
      1955. 
      
        
    1955. 
          
          
              if s
        
      1956. 
      
        
    1956. 
          
          
                s = s.split(',').collect {|ss| ss unless ss.empty?}
        
      1957. 
      
        
    1957. 
          
          
              end
        
      1958. 
      
        
    1958. 
          
          
              s
        
      1959. 
      
        
    1959. 
          
          
            end
        
      1960. 
      
        
    1960. 
          
          
          
        
      1961. 
      
        
    1961. 
          
          
            #
        
      1962. 
      
        
    1962. 
          
          
            # Regular expression with options.
        
      1963. 
      
        
    1963. 
          
          
            #
        
      1964. 
      
        
    1964. 
          1
          
            accept(Regexp, %r"\A/((?:\\.|[^\\])*)/([[:alpha:]]+)?\z|.*") do |all, s, o|
        
      1965. 
      
        
    1965. 
          
          
              f = 0
        
      1966. 
      
        
    1966. 
          
          
              if o
        
      1967. 
      
        
    1967. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::IGNORECASE if /i/ =~ o
        
      1968. 
      
        
    1968. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::MULTILINE if /m/ =~ o
        
      1969. 
      
        
    1969. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::EXTENDED if /x/ =~ o
        
      1970. 
      
        
    1970. 
          
          
                k = o.delete("imx")
        
      1971. 
      
        
    1971. 
          
          
                k = nil if k.empty?
        
      1972. 
      
        
    1972. 
          
          
              end
        
      1973. 
      
        
    1973. 
          
          
              Regexp.new(s || all, f, k)
        
      1974. 
      
        
    1974. 
          
          
            end
        
      1975. 
      
        
    1975. 
          
          
          
        
      1976. 
      
        
    1976.

    2114.

      2115. 
      
        
    2115.

      2116.

    2117.

              def options
        
      2119. 
      
        
    2119. 
          
          
                @optparse ||= OptionParser.new
        
      2120. 
      
        
    2120. 
          
          
                @optparse.default_argv = self

    2121.

      2122. 
      
        
    2122. 
          
          
                begin
        
      2123. 
      
        
    2123. 
          
          
                  yield @optparse
        
      2124. 
      
        
    2124. 
          
          
                rescue ParseError

    2126.

      2192.

    20.0 % covered

    305 relevant lines. 61 lines covered and 244 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1.

          require 'socket.so'
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
          require 'io/wait'
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
          class Addrinfo
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            # creates an Addrinfo object from the arguments.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # The arguments are interpreted as similar to self.
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("0.0.0.0", 4649).family_addrinfo("www.ruby-lang.org", 80)
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: 221.186.184.68:80 TCP (www.ruby-lang.org:80)>
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.unix("/tmp/sock").family_addrinfo("/tmp/sock2")
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: /tmp/sock2 SOCK_STREAM>
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
            def family_addrinfo(*args)
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              if args.empty?
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "no address specified"
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              elsif Addrinfo === args.first
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "too many arguments" if args.length != 1
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                addrinfo = args.first
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                if (self.pfamily != addrinfo.pfamily) ||
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                   (self.socktype != addrinfo.socktype)
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "Addrinfo type mismatch"
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                addrinfo
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              elsif self.ip?
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "IP address needs host and port but #{args.length} arguments given" if args.length != 2
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                host, port = args
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                Addrinfo.getaddrinfo(host, port, self.pfamily, self.socktype, self.protocol)[0]
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              elsif self.unix?
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "UNIX socket needs single path argument but #{args.length} arguments given" if args.length != 1
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                path, = args
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                Addrinfo.unix(path)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              else
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "unexpected family"
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            # creates a new Socket connected to the address of +local_addrinfo+.
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # If _local_addrinfo_ is nil, the address of the socket is not bound.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # The _timeout_ specify the seconds for timeout.
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # Errno::ETIMEDOUT is raised when timeout occur.
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            # If a block is given the created socket is yielded for each address.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
            def connect_internal(local_addrinfo, timeout=nil) # :yields: socket
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              sock = Socket.new(self.pfamily, self.socktype, self.protocol)
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              begin
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                sock.ipv6only! if self.ipv6?
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                sock.bind local_addrinfo if local_addrinfo
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                if timeout
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  case sock.connect_nonblock(self, exception: false)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                  when 0 # success or EISCONN, other errors raise
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    break
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  when :wait_writable
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    sock.wait_writable(timeout) or
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                      raise Errno::ETIMEDOUT, 'user specified timeout'
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  end while true
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                else
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  sock.connect(self)
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              rescue Exception
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                sock.close
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                raise
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                begin
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                  yield sock
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                  sock.close
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                end
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              else
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                sock
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            end
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          1
          
            protected :connect_internal
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect_from([local_addr_args], [opts]) {|socket| ... }
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect_from([local_addr_args], [opts])
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            #
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            # creates a socket connected to the address of self.
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
            #
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            # If one or more arguments given as _local_addr_args_,
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            # it is used as the local address of the socket.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            # _local_addr_args_ is given for family_addrinfo to obtain actual address.
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            #
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            # If _local_addr_args_ is not given, the local address of the socket is not bound.
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            #
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            # The optional last argument _opts_ is options represented by a hash.
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            # _opts_ may have following options:
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            #
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
            # [:timeout] specify the timeout in seconds.
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, it is called with the socket and the value of the block is returned.
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
            # The socket is returned otherwise.
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            #
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("www.ruby-lang.org", 80).connect_from("0.0.0.0", 4649) {|s|
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
            #     s.print "GET / HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: www.ruby-lang.org\r\n\r\n"
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            #     puts s.read
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            #
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            #   # Addrinfo object can be taken for the argument.
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("www.ruby-lang.org", 80).connect_from(Addrinfo.tcp("0.0.0.0", 4649)) {|s|
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            #     s.print "GET / HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: www.ruby-lang.org\r\n\r\n"
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            #     puts s.read
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            #
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
            def connect_from(*args, timeout: nil, &block)
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              connect_internal(family_addrinfo(*args), timeout, &block)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect([opts]) {|socket| ... }
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect([opts])
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            #
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            # creates a socket connected to the address of self.
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            #
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            # The optional argument _opts_ is options represented by a hash.
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            # _opts_ may have following options:
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            #
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            # [:timeout] specify the timeout in seconds.
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            #
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, it is called with the socket and the value of the block is returned.
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            # The socket is returned otherwise.
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            #
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("www.ruby-lang.org", 80).connect {|s|
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            #     s.print "GET / HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: www.ruby-lang.org\r\n\r\n"
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            #     puts s.read
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            #
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          1
          
            def connect(timeout: nil, &block)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
              connect_internal(nil, timeout, &block)
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect_to([remote_addr_args], [opts]) {|socket| ... }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
            #   addrinfo.connect_to([remote_addr_args], [opts])
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            #
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            # creates a socket connected to _remote_addr_args_ and bound to self.
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            #
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            # The optional last argument _opts_ is options represented by a hash.
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            # _opts_ may have following options:
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            #
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            # [:timeout] specify the timeout in seconds.
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, it is called with the socket and the value of the block is returned.
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
            # The socket is returned otherwise.
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
            #
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("0.0.0.0", 4649).connect_to("www.ruby-lang.org", 80) {|s|
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            #     s.print "GET / HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: www.ruby-lang.org\r\n\r\n"
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            #     puts s.read
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            #
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          1
          
            def connect_to(*args, timeout: nil, &block)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
              remote_addrinfo = family_addrinfo(*args)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              remote_addrinfo.connect_internal(self, timeout, &block)
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # creates a socket bound to self.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            #
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, it is called with the socket and the value of the block is returned.
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            # The socket is returned otherwise.
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            #
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.udp("0.0.0.0", 9981).bind {|s|
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            #     s.local_address.connect {|s| s.send "hello", 0 }
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            #     p s.recv(10) #=> "hello"
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          1
          
            def bind
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
              sock = Socket.new(self.pfamily, self.socktype, self.protocol)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              begin
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                sock.ipv6only! if self.ipv6?
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                sock.setsockopt(:SOCKET, :REUSEADDR, 1)
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                sock.bind(self)
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              rescue Exception
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                sock.close
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                raise
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
              end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                begin
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                  yield sock
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                  sock.close
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                end
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
              else
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                sock
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # creates a listening socket bound to self.
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
            def listen(backlog=Socket::SOMAXCONN)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              sock = Socket.new(self.pfamily, self.socktype, self.protocol)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              begin
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                sock.ipv6only! if self.ipv6?
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                sock.setsockopt(:SOCKET, :REUSEADDR, 1)
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                sock.bind(self)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                sock.listen(backlog)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              rescue Exception
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                sock.close
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                raise
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              end
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                begin
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                  yield sock
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  sock.close
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              else
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                sock
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            end
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            # iterates over the list of Addrinfo objects obtained by Addrinfo.getaddrinfo.
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            #
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.foreach(nil, 80) {|x| p x }
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: 127.0.0.1:80 TCP (:80)>
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            #   #   #<Addrinfo: 127.0.0.1:80 UDP (:80)>
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            #   #   #<Addrinfo: [::1]:80 TCP (:80)>
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            #   #   #<Addrinfo: [::1]:80 UDP (:80)>
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            #
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          1
          
            def self.foreach(nodename, service, family=nil, socktype=nil, protocol=nil, flags=nil, &block)
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              Addrinfo.getaddrinfo(nodename, service, family, socktype, protocol, flags).each(&block)
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
            end
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          end
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          1
          
          class BasicSocket < IO
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            # Returns an address of the socket suitable for connect in the local machine.
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            #
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            # This method returns _self_.local_address, except following condition.
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            #
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            # - IPv4 unspecified address (0.0.0.0) is replaced by IPv4 loopback address (127.0.0.1).
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            # - IPv6 unspecified address (::) is replaced by IPv6 loopback address (::1).
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
            #
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            # If the local address is not suitable for connect, SocketError is raised.
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            # IPv4 and IPv6 address which port is 0 is not suitable for connect.
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
            # Unix domain socket which has no path is not suitable for connect.
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("0.0.0.0", 0).listen {|serv|
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            #     p serv.connect_address #=> #<Addrinfo: 127.0.0.1:53660 TCP>
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            #     serv.connect_address.connect {|c|
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            #       s, _ = serv.accept
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            #       p [c, s] #=> [#<Socket:fd 4>, #<Socket:fd 6>]
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            #
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          1
          
            def connect_address
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              addr = local_address
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              afamily = addr.afamily
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              if afamily == Socket::AF_INET
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                raise SocketError, "unbound IPv4 socket" if addr.ip_port == 0
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                if addr.ip_address == "0.0.0.0"
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                  addr = Addrinfo.new(["AF_INET", addr.ip_port, nil, "127.0.0.1"], addr.pfamily, addr.socktype, addr.protocol)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
              elsif defined?(Socket::AF_INET6) && afamily == Socket::AF_INET6
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                raise SocketError, "unbound IPv6 socket" if addr.ip_port == 0
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                if addr.ip_address == "::"
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                  addr = Addrinfo.new(["AF_INET6", addr.ip_port, nil, "::1"], addr.pfamily, addr.socktype, addr.protocol)
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                elsif addr.ip_address == "0.0.0.0" # MacOS X 10.4 returns "a.b.c.d" for IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                  addr = Addrinfo.new(["AF_INET6", addr.ip_port, nil, "::1"], addr.pfamily, addr.socktype, addr.protocol)
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                elsif addr.ip_address == "::ffff:0.0.0.0" # MacOS X 10.6 returns "::ffff:a.b.c.d" for IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  addr = Addrinfo.new(["AF_INET6", addr.ip_port, nil, "::1"], addr.pfamily, addr.socktype, addr.protocol)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                end
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              elsif defined?(Socket::AF_UNIX) && afamily == Socket::AF_UNIX
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                raise SocketError, "unbound Unix socket" if addr.unix_path == ""
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              addr
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
            end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
            #    basicsocket.sendmsg(mesg, flags=0, dest_sockaddr=nil, *controls) => numbytes_sent
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
            #
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
            # sendmsg sends a message using sendmsg(2) system call in blocking manner.
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
            #
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
            # _mesg_ is a string to send.
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
            #
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
            # _flags_ is bitwise OR of MSG_* constants such as Socket::MSG_OOB.
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
            #
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
            # _dest_sockaddr_ is a destination socket address for connection-less socket.
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
            # It should be a sockaddr such as a result of Socket.sockaddr_in.
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
            # An Addrinfo object can be used too.
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            #
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
            # _controls_ is a list of ancillary data.
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
            # The element of _controls_ should be Socket::AncillaryData or
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
            # 3-elements array.
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
            # The 3-element array should contains cmsg_level, cmsg_type and data.
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
            #
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
            # The return value, _numbytes_sent_ is an integer which is the number of bytes sent.
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
            #
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
            # sendmsg can be used to implement send_io as follows:
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
            #
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
            #   # use Socket::AncillaryData.
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
            #   ancdata = Socket::AncillaryData.int(:UNIX, :SOCKET, :RIGHTS, io.fileno)
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
            #   sock.sendmsg("a", 0, nil, ancdata)
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
            #
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            #   # use 3-element array.
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
            #   ancdata = [:SOCKET, :RIGHTS, [io.fileno].pack("i!")]
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
            #   sock.sendmsg("\0", 0, nil, ancdata)
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          1
          
            def sendmsg(mesg, flags = 0, dest_sockaddr = nil, *controls)
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              __sendmsg(mesg, flags, dest_sockaddr, controls)
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            end
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
          
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            #    basicsocket.sendmsg_nonblock(mesg, flags=0, dest_sockaddr=nil, *controls, opts={}) => numbytes_sent
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            #
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
            # sendmsg_nonblock sends a message using sendmsg(2) system call in non-blocking manner.
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
            #
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
            # It is similar to BasicSocket#sendmsg
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
            # but the non-blocking flag is set before the system call
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
            # and it doesn't retry the system call.
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
            #
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
            # that sendmsg_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitWritable exception, but
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_writable+ instead.
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          1
          
            def sendmsg_nonblock(mesg, flags = 0, dest_sockaddr = nil, *controls,
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                                 exception: true)
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              __sendmsg_nonblock(mesg, flags, dest_sockaddr, controls, exception)
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            end
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
            # 	basicsocket.recv_nonblock(maxlen [, flags [, buf [, options ]]]) => mesg
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
            #
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
            # Receives up to _maxlen_ bytes from +socket+ using recvfrom(2) after
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            # _flags_ is zero or more of the +MSG_+ options.
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            # The result, _mesg_, is the data received.
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
            #
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
            # When recvfrom(2) returns 0, Socket#recv_nonblock returns
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
            # an empty string as data.
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            # The meaning depends on the socket: EOF on TCP, empty packet on UDP, etc.
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
            #
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
            # === Parameters
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
            # * +maxlen+ - the number of bytes to receive from the socket
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
            # * +flags+ - zero or more of the +MSG_+ options
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
            # * +buf+ - destination String buffer
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
            # * +options+ - keyword hash, supporting `exception: false`
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
            #
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
            # 	serv = TCPServer.new("127.0.0.1", 0)
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            # 	af, port, host, addr = serv.addr
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
            # 	c = TCPSocket.new(addr, port)
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            # 	s = serv.accept
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
            # 	c.send "aaa", 0
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
            # 	begin # emulate blocking recv.
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
            # 	  p s.recv_nonblock(10) #=> "aaa"
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
            # 	rescue IO::WaitReadable
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
            # 	  IO.select([s])
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            # 	  retry
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            # 	end
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            #
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#recvfrom for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
            # to _recv_nonblock_ fails.
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
            #
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
            # BasicSocket#recv_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to recvfrom(2) failure,
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
            #
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK or Errno::EAGAIN,
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying recv_nonblock.
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
            #
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            # that recv_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
            #
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            # * Socket#recvfrom
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          1
          
            def recv_nonblock(len, flag = 0, str = nil, exception: true)
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              __recv_nonblock(len, flag, str, exception)
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
            end
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
          
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            #    basicsocket.recvmsg(maxmesglen=nil, flags=0, maxcontrollen=nil, opts={}) => [mesg, sender_addrinfo, rflags, *controls]
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            #
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            # recvmsg receives a message using recvmsg(2) system call in blocking manner.
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            #
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
            # _maxmesglen_ is the maximum length of mesg to receive.
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            #
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
            # _flags_ is bitwise OR of MSG_* constants such as Socket::MSG_PEEK.
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
            #
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
            # _maxcontrollen_ is the maximum length of controls (ancillary data) to receive.
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
            #
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
            # _opts_ is option hash.
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
            # Currently :scm_rights=>bool is the only option.
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
            #
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
            # :scm_rights option specifies that application expects SCM_RIGHTS control message.
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
            # If the value is nil or false, application don't expects SCM_RIGHTS control message.
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
            # In this case, recvmsg closes the passed file descriptors immediately.
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
            # This is the default behavior.
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
            #
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
            # If :scm_rights value is neither nil nor false, application expects SCM_RIGHTS control message.
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
            # In this case, recvmsg creates IO objects for each file descriptors for
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
            # Socket::AncillaryData#unix_rights method.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
            #
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
            # The return value is 4-elements array.
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
            #
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
            # _mesg_ is a string of the received message.
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
            #
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
            # _sender_addrinfo_ is a sender socket address for connection-less socket.
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
            # It is an Addrinfo object.
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
            # For connection-oriented socket such as TCP, sender_addrinfo is platform dependent.
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
            #
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
            # _rflags_ is a flags on the received message which is bitwise OR of MSG_* constants such as Socket::MSG_TRUNC.
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
            # It will be nil if the system uses 4.3BSD style old recvmsg system call.
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
            #
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
            # _controls_ is ancillary data which is an array of Socket::AncillaryData objects such as:
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
            #
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
            #   #<Socket::AncillaryData: AF_UNIX SOCKET RIGHTS 7>
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
            #
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
            # _maxmesglen_ and _maxcontrollen_ can be nil.
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
            # In that case, the buffer will be grown until the message is not truncated.
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
            # Internally, MSG_PEEK is used.
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
            # Buffer full and MSG_CTRUNC are checked for truncation.
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
            #
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
            # recvmsg can be used to implement recv_io as follows:
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
            #
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
            #   mesg, sender_sockaddr, rflags, *controls = sock.recvmsg(:scm_rights=>true)
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
            #   controls.each {|ancdata|
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
            #     if ancdata.cmsg_is?(:SOCKET, :RIGHTS)
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
            #       return ancdata.unix_rights[0]
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          1
          
            def recvmsg(dlen = nil, flags = 0, clen = nil, scm_rights: false)
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
              __recvmsg(dlen, flags, clen, scm_rights)
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
            end
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
          
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
            #    basicsocket.recvmsg_nonblock(maxdatalen=nil, flags=0, maxcontrollen=nil, opts={}) => [data, sender_addrinfo, rflags, *controls]
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
            #
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
            # recvmsg receives a message using recvmsg(2) system call in non-blocking manner.
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
            #
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
            # It is similar to BasicSocket#recvmsg
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
            # but non-blocking flag is set before the system call
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
            # and it doesn't retry the system call.
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
            #
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
            # that recvmsg_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          1
          
            def recvmsg_nonblock(dlen = nil, flags = 0, clen = nil,
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
                                 scm_rights: false, exception: true)
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
              __recvmsg_nonblock(dlen, flags, clen, scm_rights, exception)
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            end
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
          
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
            # Linux-specific optimizations to avoid fcntl for IO#read_nonblock
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
            # and IO#write_nonblock using MSG_DONTWAIT
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
            # Do other platforms support MSG_DONTWAIT reliably?
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          1
          
            if RUBY_PLATFORM =~ /linux/ && Socket.const_defined?(:MSG_DONTWAIT)
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          1
          
              def read_nonblock(len, str = nil, exception: true) # :nodoc:
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          184
          
                __read_nonblock(len, str, exception)
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
              end
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
          
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          1
          
              def write_nonblock(buf, exception: true) # :nodoc:
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          117
          
                __write_nonblock(buf, exception)
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
              end
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
            end
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
          end
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
          
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          1
          
          class Socket < BasicSocket
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
            # enable the socket option IPV6_V6ONLY if IPV6_V6ONLY is available.
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          1
          
            def ipv6only!
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
              if defined? Socket::IPV6_V6ONLY
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                self.setsockopt(:IPV6, :V6ONLY, 1)
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
              end
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
            end
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
          
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
            #   socket.recvfrom_nonblock(maxlen[, flags[, outbuf[, opts]]]) => [mesg, sender_addrinfo]
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
            #
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
            # Receives up to _maxlen_ bytes from +socket+ using recvfrom(2) after
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
            # _flags_ is zero or more of the +MSG_+ options.
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            # The first element of the results, _mesg_, is the data received.
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
            # The second element, _sender_addrinfo_, contains protocol-specific address
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
            # information of the sender.
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
            #
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
            # When recvfrom(2) returns 0, Socket#recvfrom_nonblock returns
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
            # an empty string as data.
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
            # The meaning depends on the socket: EOF on TCP, empty packet on UDP, etc.
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
            #
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
            # === Parameters
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
            # * +maxlen+ - the maximum number of bytes to receive from the socket
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
            # * +flags+ - zero or more of the +MSG_+ options
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
            # * +outbuf+ - destination String buffer
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
            # * +opts+ - keyword hash, supporting `exception: false`
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
            #
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
            #   # In one file, start this first
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
            #   require 'socket'
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
            #   include Socket::Constants
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.new(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
            #   sockaddr = Socket.sockaddr_in(2200, 'localhost')
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
            #   socket.bind(sockaddr)
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
            #   socket.listen(5)
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
            #   client, client_addrinfo = socket.accept
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
            #   begin # emulate blocking recvfrom
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
            #     pair = client.recvfrom_nonblock(20)
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitReadable
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
            #     IO.select([client])
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
            #   data = pair[0].chomp
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
            #   puts "I only received 20 bytes '#{data}'"
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
            #   sleep 1
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
            #   socket.close
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
            #
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
            #   # In another file, start this second
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
            #   require 'socket'
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
            #   include Socket::Constants
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.new(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
            #   sockaddr = Socket.sockaddr_in(2200, 'localhost')
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
            #   socket.connect(sockaddr)
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
            #   socket.puts "Watch this get cut short!"
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
            #   socket.close
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
            #
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#recvfrom for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
            # to _recvfrom_nonblock_ fails.
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
            #
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
            # Socket#recvfrom_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to recvfrom(2) failure,
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
            #
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK or Errno::EAGAIN,
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
            # recvfrom_nonblock.
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
            #
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
            # that recvfrom_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
            #
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
            # * Socket#recvfrom
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          1
          
            def recvfrom_nonblock(len, flag = 0, str = nil, exception: true)
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
              __recvfrom_nonblock(len, flag, str, exception)
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
            end
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
          
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
            #   socket.accept_nonblock([options]) => [client_socket, client_addrinfo]
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
            #
        
      542.
