    542. 
          
          
            # Accepts an incoming connection using accept(2) after
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          
          
            # It returns an array containing the accepted socket
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
            # for the incoming connection, _client_socket_,
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
            # and an Addrinfo, _client_addrinfo_.
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
            #
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
            #   # In one script, start this first
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
            #   require 'socket'
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
            #   include Socket::Constants
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.new(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
            #   sockaddr = Socket.sockaddr_in(2200, 'localhost')
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
            #   socket.bind(sockaddr)
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
            #   socket.listen(5)
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
            #   begin # emulate blocking accept
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
            #     client_socket, client_addrinfo = socket.accept_nonblock
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitReadable, Errno::EINTR
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
            #     IO.select([socket])
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
            #   puts "The client said, '#{client_socket.readline.chomp}'"
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
            #   client_socket.puts "Hello from script one!"
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
            #   socket.close
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
            #
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
            #   # In another script, start this second
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
            #   require 'socket'
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
            #   include Socket::Constants
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.new(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
            #   sockaddr = Socket.sockaddr_in(2200, 'localhost')
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
            #   socket.connect(sockaddr)
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
            #   socket.puts "Hello from script 2."
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
            #   puts "The server said, '#{socket.readline.chomp}'"
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
            #   socket.close
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
            #
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#accept for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
            # to _accept_nonblock_ fails.
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
            #
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
            # Socket#accept_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to accept(2) failure,
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
            #
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK, Errno::EAGAIN, Errno::ECONNABORTED or Errno::EPROTO,
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying accept_nonblock.
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
            #
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
            # that accept_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
            #
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
            # * Socket#accept
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          1
          
            def accept_nonblock(exception: true)
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
              __accept_nonblock(exception)
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
            end
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
          
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp(host, port, local_host=nil, local_port=nil, [opts]) {|socket| ... }
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp(host, port, local_host=nil, local_port=nil, [opts])
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
            #
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
            # creates a new socket object connected to host:port using TCP/IP.
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
            #
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
            # If local_host:local_port is given,
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          
          
            # the socket is bound to it.
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
            #
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
            # The optional last argument _opts_ is options represented by a hash.
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
            # _opts_ may have following options:
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
            #
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
            # [:connect_timeout] specify the timeout in seconds.
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
            #
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, the block is called with the socket.
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          
          
            # The value of the block is returned.
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          
          
            # The socket is closed when this method returns.
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
            #
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
            # If no block is given, the socket is returned.
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
            #
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp("www.ruby-lang.org", 80) {|sock|
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
            #     sock.print "GET / HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: www.ruby-lang.org\r\n\r\n"
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          
          
            #     sock.close_write
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
            #     puts sock.read
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
            #
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          1
          
            def self.tcp(host, port, local_host = nil, local_port = nil, connect_timeout: nil) # :yield: socket
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
              last_error = nil
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          
          
              ret = nil
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          
          
          
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
              local_addr_list = nil
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
              if local_host != nil || local_port != nil
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
                local_addr_list = Addrinfo.getaddrinfo(local_host, local_port, nil, :STREAM, nil)
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          
          
              end
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
          
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
              Addrinfo.foreach(host, port, nil, :STREAM) {|ai|
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
                if local_addr_list
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
                  local_addr = local_addr_list.find {|local_ai| local_ai.afamily == ai.afamily }
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
                  next unless local_addr
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
                else
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
                  local_addr = nil
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
                end
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                begin
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                  sock = local_addr ?
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
                    ai.connect_from(local_addr, timeout: connect_timeout) :
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
                    ai.connect(timeout: connect_timeout)
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                rescue SystemCallError
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
                  last_error = $!
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
                  next
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                end
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
                ret = sock
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
                break
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
              }
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
              unless ret
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                if last_error
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                  raise last_error
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                else
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
                  raise SocketError, "no appropriate local address"
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
                end
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
              end
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
                begin
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
                  yield ret
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          
          
                  ret.close
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
                end
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
              else
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          
          
                ret
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
              end
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
            end
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
          
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
            # :stopdoc:
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          1
          
            def self.ip_sockets_port0(ai_list, reuseaddr)
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
              sockets = []
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
              begin
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
                sockets.clear
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          
          
                port = nil
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          
          
                ai_list.each {|ai|
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
                    s = Socket.new(ai.pfamily, ai.socktype, ai.protocol)
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
                  rescue SystemCallError
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
                    next
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
                  end
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          
          
                  sockets << s
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
                  s.ipv6only! if ai.ipv6?
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
                  if reuseaddr
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
                    s.setsockopt(:SOCKET, :REUSEADDR, 1)
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                  end
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
                  unless port
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
                    s.bind(ai)
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
                    port = s.local_address.ip_port
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
                  else
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
                    s.bind(ai.family_addrinfo(ai.ip_address, port))
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
                  end
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          
          
                }
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::EADDRINUSE
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
                sockets.each(&:close)
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
                retry
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
              rescue Exception
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          
          
                sockets.each(&:close)
        
      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
                raise
        
      697. 
      
        
    697. 
          
          
              end
        
      698. 
      
        
    698. 
          
          
              sockets
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          
          
            end
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          1
          
              private :ip_sockets_port0
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
            end
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          
          
          
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          1
          
            def self.tcp_server_sockets_port0(host)
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
              ai_list = Addrinfo.getaddrinfo(host, 0, nil, :STREAM, nil, Socket::AI_PASSIVE)
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          
          
              sockets = ip_sockets_port0(ai_list, true)
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          
          
              begin
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          
          
                sockets.each {|s|
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                  s.listen(Socket::SOMAXCONN)
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
                }
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          
          
              rescue Exception
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          
          
                sockets.each(&:close)
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
                raise
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
              end
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
              sockets
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          
          
            end
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          1
          
              private :tcp_server_sockets_port0
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
            end
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          
          
            # :startdoc:
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          
          
          
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
            # creates TCP/IP server sockets for _host_ and _port_.
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
            # _host_ is optional.
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          
          
            #
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          
          
            # If no block given,
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
            # it returns an array of listening sockets.
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
            #
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, the block is called with the sockets.
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          
          
            # The value of the block is returned.
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          
          
            # The socket is closed when this method returns.
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          
          
            #
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          
          
            # If _port_ is 0, actual port number is chosen dynamically.
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
            # However all sockets in the result has same port number.
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          
          
            #
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          
          
            #   # tcp_server_sockets returns two sockets.
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
            #   sockets = Socket.tcp_server_sockets(1296)
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
            #   p sockets #=> [#<Socket:fd 3>, #<Socket:fd 4>]
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          
          
            #
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          
          
            #   # The sockets contains IPv6 and IPv4 sockets.
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
            #   sockets.each {|s| p s.local_address }
        
      741. 
      
        
    741. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: [::]:1296 TCP>
        
      742. 
      
        
    742. 
          
          
            #   #   #<Addrinfo: 0.0.0.0:1296 TCP>
        
      743. 
      
        
    743. 
          
          
            #
        
      744. 
      
        
    744. 
          
          
            #   # IPv6 and IPv4 socket has same port number, 53114, even if it is chosen dynamically.
        
      745. 
      
        
    745. 
          
          
            #   sockets = Socket.tcp_server_sockets(0)
        
      746. 
      
        
    746. 
          
          
            #   sockets.each {|s| p s.local_address }
        
      747. 
      
        
    747. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: [::]:53114 TCP>
        
      748. 
      
        
    748. 
          
          
            #   #   #<Addrinfo: 0.0.0.0:53114 TCP>
        
      749. 
      
        
    749. 
          
          
            #
        
      750. 
      
        
    750. 
          
          
            #   # The block is called with the sockets.
        
      751. 
      
        
    751. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp_server_sockets(0) {|sockets|
        
      752. 
      
        
    752. 
          
          
            #     p sockets #=> [#<Socket:fd 3>, #<Socket:fd 4>]
        
      753. 
      
        
    753. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      754. 
      
        
    754. 
          
          
            #
        
      755. 
      
        
    755. 
          1
          
            def self.tcp_server_sockets(host=nil, port)
        
      756. 
      
        
    756. 
          
          
              if port == 0
        
      757. 
      
        
    757. 
          
          
                sockets = tcp_server_sockets_port0(host)
        
      758. 
      
        
    758. 
          
          
              else
        
      759. 
      
        
    759. 
          
          
                last_error = nil
        
      760. 
      
        
    760. 
          
          
                sockets = []
        
      761. 
      
        
    761. 
          
          
                begin
        
      762. 
      
        
    762. 
          
          
                  Addrinfo.foreach(host, port, nil, :STREAM, nil, Socket::AI_PASSIVE) {|ai|
        
      763. 
      
        
    763. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      764. 
      
        
    764. 
          
          
                      s = ai.listen
        
      765. 
      
        
    765. 
          
          
                    rescue SystemCallError
        
      766. 
      
        
    766. 
          
          
                      last_error = $!
        
      767. 
      
        
    767. 
          
          
                      next
        
      768. 
      
        
    768. 
          
          
                    end
        
      769. 
      
        
    769. 
          
          
                    sockets << s
        
      770. 
      
        
    770. 
          
          
                  }
        
      771. 
      
        
    771. 
          
          
                  if sockets.empty?
        
      772. 
      
        
    772. 
          
          
                    raise last_error
        
      773. 
      
        
    773. 
          
          
                  end
        
      774. 
      
        
    774. 
          
          
                rescue Exception
        
      775. 
      
        
    775. 
          
          
                  sockets.each(&:close)
        
      776. 
      
        
    776. 
          
          
                  raise
        
      777. 
      
        
    777. 
          
          
                end
        
      778. 
      
        
    778. 
          
          
              end
        
      779. 
      
        
    779. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      780. 
      
        
    780. 
          
          
                begin
        
      781. 
      
        
    781. 
          
          
                  yield sockets
        
      782. 
      
        
    782. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      783. 
      
        
    783. 
          
          
                  sockets.each(&:close)
        
      784. 
      
        
    784. 
          
          
                end
        
      785. 
      
        
    785. 
          
          
              else
        
      786. 
      
        
    786. 
          
          
                sockets
        
      787. 
      
        
    787. 
          
          
              end
        
      788. 
      
        
    788. 
          
          
            end
        
      789. 
      
        
    789. 
          
          
          
        
      790. 
      
        
    790. 
          
          
            # yield socket and client address for each a connection accepted via given sockets.
        
      791. 
      
        
    791. 
          
          
            #
        
      792. 
      
        
    792. 
          
          
            # The arguments are a list of sockets.
        
      793. 
      
        
    793. 
          
          
            # The individual argument should be a socket or an array of sockets.
        
      794. 
      
        
    794. 
          
          
            #
        
      795. 
      
        
    795. 
          
          
            # This method yields the block sequentially.
        
      796. 
      
        
    796. 
          
          
            # It means that the next connection is not accepted until the block returns.
        
      797. 
      
        
    797. 
          
          
            # So concurrent mechanism, thread for example, should be used to service multiple clients at a time.
        
      798. 
      
        
    798. 
          
          
            #
        
      799. 
      
        
    799. 
          1
          
            def self.accept_loop(*sockets) # :yield: socket, client_addrinfo
        
      800. 
      
        
    800. 
          
          
              sockets.flatten!(1)
        
      801. 
      
        
    801. 
          
          
              if sockets.empty?
        
      802. 
      
        
    802. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "no sockets"
        
      803. 
      
        
    803. 
          
          
              end
        
      804. 
      
        
    804. 
          
          
              loop {
        
      805. 
      
        
    805. 
          
          
                readable, _, _ = IO.select(sockets)
        
      806. 
      
        
    806. 
          
          
                readable.each {|r|
        
      807. 
      
        
    807. 
          
          
                  sock, addr = r.accept_nonblock(exception: false)
        
      808. 
      
        
    808. 
          
          
                  next if sock == :wait_readable
        
      809. 
      
        
    809. 
          
          
                  yield sock, addr
        
      810. 
      
        
    810. 
          
          
                }
        
      811. 
      
        
    811. 
          
          
              }
        
      812. 
      
        
    812. 
          
          
            end
        
      813. 
      
        
    813. 
          
          
          
        
      814. 
      
        
    814. 
          
          
            # creates a TCP/IP server on _port_ and calls the block for each connection accepted.
        
      815. 
      
        
    815. 
          
          
            # The block is called with a socket and a client_address as an Addrinfo object.
        
      816. 
      
        
    816. 
          
          
            #
        
      817. 
      
        
    817. 
          
          
            # If _host_ is specified, it is used with _port_ to determine the server addresses.
        
      818. 
      
        
    818. 
          
          
            #
        
      819. 
      
        
    819. 
          
          
            # The socket is *not* closed when the block returns.
        
      820. 
      
        
    820. 
          
          
            # So application should close it explicitly.
        
      821. 
      
        
    821. 
          
          
            #
        
      822. 
      
        
    822. 
          
          
            # This method calls the block sequentially.
        
      823. 
      
        
    823. 
          
          
            # It means that the next connection is not accepted until the block returns.
        
      824. 
      
        
    824. 
          
          
            # So concurrent mechanism, thread for example, should be used to service multiple clients at a time.
        
      825. 
      
        
    825. 
          
          
            #
        
      826. 
      
        
    826. 
          
          
            # Note that Addrinfo.getaddrinfo is used to determine the server socket addresses.
        
      827. 
      
        
    827. 
          
          
            # When Addrinfo.getaddrinfo returns two or more addresses,
        
      828. 
      
        
    828. 
          
          
            # IPv4 and IPv6 address for example,
        
      829. 
      
        
    829. 
          
          
            # all of them are used.
        
      830. 
      
        
    830. 
          
          
            # Socket.tcp_server_loop succeeds if one socket can be used at least.
        
      831. 
      
        
    831. 
          
          
            #
        
      832. 
      
        
    832. 
          
          
            #   # Sequential echo server.
        
      833. 
      
        
    833. 
          
          
            #   # It services only one client at a time.
        
      834. 
      
        
    834. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp_server_loop(16807) {|sock, client_addrinfo|
        
      835. 
      
        
    835. 
          
          
            #     begin
        
      836. 
      
        
    836. 
          
          
            #       IO.copy_stream(sock, sock)
        
      837. 
      
        
    837. 
          
          
            #     ensure
        
      838. 
      
        
    838. 
          
          
            #       sock.close
        
      839. 
      
        
    839. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      840. 
      
        
    840. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      841. 
      
        
    841. 
          
          
            #
        
      842. 
      
        
    842. 
          
          
            #   # Threaded echo server
        
      843. 
      
        
    843. 
          
          
            #   # It services multiple clients at a time.
        
      844. 
      
        
    844. 
          
          
            #   # Note that it may accept connections too much.
        
      845. 
      
        
    845. 
          
          
            #   Socket.tcp_server_loop(16807) {|sock, client_addrinfo|
        
      846. 
      
        
    846. 
          
          
            #     Thread.new {
        
      847. 
      
        
    847. 
          
          
            #       begin
        
      848. 
      
        
    848. 
          
          
            #         IO.copy_stream(sock, sock)
        
      849. 
      
        
    849. 
          
          
            #       ensure
        
      850. 
      
        
    850. 
          
          
            #         sock.close
        
      851. 
      
        
    851. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      852. 
      
        
    852. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      853. 
      
        
    853. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      854. 
      
        
    854. 
          
          
            #
        
      855. 
      
        
    855. 
          1
          
            def self.tcp_server_loop(host=nil, port, &b) # :yield: socket, client_addrinfo
        
      856. 
      
        
    856. 
          
          
              tcp_server_sockets(host, port) {|sockets|
        
      857. 
      
        
    857. 
          
          
                accept_loop(sockets, &b)
        
      858. 
      
        
    858. 
          
          
              }
        
      859. 
      
        
    859. 
          
          
            end
        
      860. 
      
        
    860. 
          
          
          
        
      861. 
      
        
    861. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      862. 
      
        
    862. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_sockets([host, ] port)
        
      863. 
      
        
    863. 
          
          
            #
        
      864. 
      
        
    864. 
          
          
            # Creates UDP/IP sockets for a UDP server.
        
      865. 
      
        
    865. 
          
          
            #
        
      866. 
      
        
    866. 
          
          
            # If no block given, it returns an array of sockets.
        
      867. 
      
        
    867. 
          
          
            #
        
      868. 
      
        
    868. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, the block is called with the sockets.
        
      869. 
      
        
    869. 
          
          
            # The value of the block is returned.
        
      870. 
      
        
    870. 
          
          
            # The sockets are closed when this method returns.
        
      871. 
      
        
    871. 
          
          
            #
        
      872. 
      
        
    872. 
          
          
            # If _port_ is zero, some port is chosen.
        
      873. 
      
        
    873. 
          
          
            # But the chosen port is used for the all sockets.
        
      874. 
      
        
    874. 
          
          
            #
        
      875. 
      
        
    875. 
          
          
            #   # UDP/IP echo server
        
      876. 
      
        
    876. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_sockets(0) {|sockets|
        
      877. 
      
        
    877. 
          
          
            #     p sockets.first.local_address.ip_port     #=> 32963
        
      878. 
      
        
    878. 
          
          
            #     Socket.udp_server_loop_on(sockets) {|msg, msg_src|
        
      879. 
      
        
    879. 
          
          
            #       msg_src.reply msg
        
      880. 
      
        
    880. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      881. 
      
        
    881. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      882. 
      
        
    882. 
          
          
            #
        
      883. 
      
        
    883. 
          1
          
            def self.udp_server_sockets(host=nil, port)
        
      884. 
      
        
    884. 
          
          
              last_error = nil
        
      885. 
      
        
    885. 
          
          
              sockets = []
        
      886. 
      
        
    886. 
          
          
          
        
      887. 
      
        
    887. 
          
          
              ipv6_recvpktinfo = nil
        
      888. 
      
        
    888. 
          
          
              if defined? Socket::AncillaryData
        
      889. 
      
        
    889. 
          
          
                if defined? Socket::IPV6_RECVPKTINFO # RFC 3542
        
      890. 
      
        
    890. 
          
          
                  ipv6_recvpktinfo = Socket::IPV6_RECVPKTINFO
        
      891. 
      
        
    891. 
          
          
                elsif defined? Socket::IPV6_PKTINFO # RFC 2292
        
      892. 
      
        
    892. 
          
          
                  ipv6_recvpktinfo = Socket::IPV6_PKTINFO
        
      893. 
      
        
    893. 
          
          
                end
        
      894. 
      
        
    894. 
          
          
              end
        
      895. 
      
        
    895. 
          
          
          
        
      896. 
      
        
    896. 
          
          
              local_addrs = Socket.ip_address_list
        
      897. 
      
        
    897. 
          
          
          
        
      898. 
      
        
    898. 
          
          
              ip_list = []
        
      899. 
      
        
    899. 
          
          
              Addrinfo.foreach(host, port, nil, :DGRAM, nil, Socket::AI_PASSIVE) {|ai|
        
      900. 
      
        
    900. 
          
          
                if ai.ipv4? && ai.ip_address == "0.0.0.0"
        
      901. 
      
        
    901. 
          
          
                  local_addrs.each {|a|
        
      902. 
      
        
    902. 
          
          
                    next unless a.ipv4?
        
      903. 
      
        
    903. 
          
          
                    ip_list << Addrinfo.new(a.to_sockaddr, :INET, :DGRAM, 0);
        
      904. 
      
        
    904. 
          
          
                  }
        
      905. 
      
        
    905. 
          
          
                elsif ai.ipv6? && ai.ip_address == "::" && !ipv6_recvpktinfo
        
      906. 
      
        
    906. 
          
          
                  local_addrs.each {|a|
        
      907. 
      
        
    907. 
          
          
                    next unless a.ipv6?
        
      908. 
      
        
    908. 
          
          
                    ip_list << Addrinfo.new(a.to_sockaddr, :INET6, :DGRAM, 0);
        
      909. 
      
        
    909. 
          
          
                  }
        
      910. 
      
        
    910. 
          
          
                else
        
      911. 
      
        
    911. 
          
          
                  ip_list << ai
        
      912. 
      
        
    912. 
          
          
                end
        
      913. 
      
        
    913. 
          
          
              }
        
      914. 
      
        
    914. 
          
          
              ip_list.uniq!(&:to_sockaddr)
        
      915. 
      
        
    915. 
          
          
          
        
      916. 
      
        
    916. 
          
          
              if port == 0
        
      917. 
      
        
    917. 
          
          
                sockets = ip_sockets_port0(ip_list, false)
        
      918. 
      
        
    918. 
          
          
              else
        
      919. 
      
        
    919. 
          
          
                ip_list.each {|ip|
        
      920. 
      
        
    920. 
          
          
                  ai = Addrinfo.udp(ip.ip_address, port)
        
      921. 
      
        
    921. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      922. 
      
        
    922. 
          
          
                    s = ai.bind
        
      923. 
      
        
    923. 
          
          
                  rescue SystemCallError
        
      924. 
      
        
    924. 
          
          
                    last_error = $!
        
      925. 
      
        
    925. 
          
          
                    next
        
      926. 
      
        
    926. 
          
          
                  end
        
      927. 
      
        
    927. 
          
          
                  sockets << s
        
      928. 
      
        
    928. 
          
          
                }
        
      929. 
      
        
    929. 
          
          
                if sockets.empty?
        
      930. 
      
        
    930. 
          
          
                  raise last_error
        
      931. 
      
        
    931. 
          
          
                end
        
      932. 
      
        
    932. 
          
          
              end
        
      933. 
      
        
    933. 
          
          
          
        
      934. 
      
        
    934. 
          
          
              sockets.each {|s|
        
      935. 
      
        
    935. 
          
          
                ai = s.local_address
        
      936. 
      
        
    936. 
          
          
                if ipv6_recvpktinfo && ai.ipv6? && ai.ip_address == "::"
        
      937. 
      
        
    937. 
          
          
                  s.setsockopt(:IPV6, ipv6_recvpktinfo, 1)
        
      938. 
      
        
    938. 
          
          
                end
        
      939. 
      
        
    939. 
          
          
              }
        
      940. 
      
        
    940. 
          
          
          
        
      941. 
      
        
    941. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      942. 
      
        
    942. 
          
          
                begin
        
      943. 
      
        
    943. 
          
          
                  yield sockets
        
      944. 
      
        
    944. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      945. 
      
        
    945. 
          
          
                  sockets.each(&:close) if sockets
        
      946. 
      
        
    946. 
          
          
                end
        
      947. 
      
        
    947. 
          
          
              else
        
      948. 
      
        
    948. 
          
          
                sockets
        
      949. 
      
        
    949. 
          
          
              end
        
      950. 
      
        
    950. 
          
          
            end
        
      951. 
      
        
    951. 
          
          
          
        
      952. 
      
        
    952. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      953. 
      
        
    953. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_recv(sockets) {|msg, msg_src| ... }
        
      954. 
      
        
    954. 
          
          
            #
        
      955. 
      
        
    955. 
          
          
            # Receive UDP/IP packets from the given _sockets_.
        
      956. 
      
        
    956. 
          
          
            # For each packet received, the block is called.
        
      957. 
      
        
    957. 
          
          
            #
        
      958. 
      
        
    958. 
          
          
            # The block receives _msg_ and _msg_src_.
        
      959. 
      
        
    959. 
          
          
            # _msg_ is a string which is the payload of the received packet.
        
      960. 
      
        
    960. 
          
          
            # _msg_src_ is a Socket::UDPSource object which is used for reply.
        
      961. 
      
        
    961. 
          
          
            #
        
      962. 
      
        
    962. 
          
          
            # Socket.udp_server_loop can be implemented using this method as follows.
        
      963. 
      
        
    963. 
          
          
            #
        
      964. 
      
        
    964. 
          
          
            #   udp_server_sockets(host, port) {|sockets|
        
      965. 
      
        
    965. 
          
          
            #     loop {
        
      966. 
      
        
    966. 
          
          
            #       readable, _, _ = IO.select(sockets)
        
      967. 
      
        
    967. 
          
          
            #       udp_server_recv(readable) {|msg, msg_src| ... }
        
      968. 
      
        
    968. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      969. 
      
        
    969. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      970. 
      
        
    970. 
          
          
            #
        
      971. 
      
        
    971. 
          1
          
            def self.udp_server_recv(sockets)
        
      972. 
      
        
    972. 
          
          
              sockets.each {|r|
        
      973. 
      
        
    973. 
          
          
                msg, sender_addrinfo, _, *controls = r.recvmsg_nonblock(exception: false)
        
      974. 
      
        
    974. 
          
          
                next if msg == :wait_readable
        
      975. 
      
        
    975. 
          
          
                ai = r.local_address
        
      976. 
      
        
    976. 
          
          
                if ai.ipv6? and pktinfo = controls.find {|c| c.cmsg_is?(:IPV6, :PKTINFO) }
        
      977. 
      
        
    977. 
          
          
                  ai = Addrinfo.udp(pktinfo.ipv6_pktinfo_addr.ip_address, ai.ip_port)
        
      978. 
      
        
    978. 
          
          
                  yield msg, UDPSource.new(sender_addrinfo, ai) {|reply_msg|
        
      979. 
      
        
    979. 
          
          
                    r.sendmsg reply_msg, 0, sender_addrinfo, pktinfo
        
      980. 
      
        
    980. 
          
          
                  }
        
      981. 
      
        
    981. 
          
          
                else
        
      982. 
      
        
    982. 
          
          
                  yield msg, UDPSource.new(sender_addrinfo, ai) {|reply_msg|
        
      983. 
      
        
    983. 
          
          
                    r.send reply_msg, 0, sender_addrinfo
        
      984. 
      
        
    984. 
          
          
                  }
        
      985. 
      
        
    985. 
          
          
                end
        
      986. 
      
        
    986. 
          
          
              }
        
      987. 
      
        
    987. 
          
          
            end
        
      988. 
      
        
    988. 
          
          
          
        
      989. 
      
        
    989. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      990. 
      
        
    990. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_loop_on(sockets) {|msg, msg_src| ... }
        
      991. 
      
        
    991. 
          
          
            #
        
      992. 
      
        
    992. 
          
          
            # Run UDP/IP server loop on the given sockets.
        
      993. 
      
        
    993. 
          
          
            #
        
      994. 
      
        
    994. 
          
          
            # The return value of Socket.udp_server_sockets is appropriate for the argument.
        
      995. 
      
        
    995. 
          
          
            #
        
      996. 
      
        
    996. 
          
          
            # It calls the block for each message received.
        
      997. 
      
        
    997. 
          
          
            #
        
      998. 
      
        
    998. 
          1
          
            def self.udp_server_loop_on(sockets, &b) # :yield: msg, msg_src
        
      999. 
      
        
    999. 
          
          
              loop {
        
      1000. 
      
        
    1000. 
          
          
                readable, _, _ = IO.select(sockets)
        
      1001. 
      
        
    1001. 
          
          
                udp_server_recv(readable, &b)
        
      1002. 
      
        
    1002. 
          
          
              }
        
      1003. 
      
        
    1003. 
          
          
            end
        
      1004. 
      
        
    1004. 
          
          
          
        
      1005. 
      
        
    1005. 
          
          
            # :call-seq:
        
      1006. 
      
        
    1006. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_loop(port) {|msg, msg_src| ... }
        
      1007. 
      
        
    1007. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_loop(host, port) {|msg, msg_src| ... }
        
      1008. 
      
        
    1008. 
          
          
            #
        
      1009. 
      
        
    1009. 
          
          
            # creates a UDP/IP server on _port_ and calls the block for each message arrived.
        
      1010. 
      
        
    1010. 
          
          
            # The block is called with the message and its source information.
        
      1011. 
      
        
    1011. 
          
          
            #
        
      1012. 
      
        
    1012. 
          
          
            # This method allocates sockets internally using _port_.
        
      1013. 
      
        
    1013. 
          
          
            # If _host_ is specified, it is used conjunction with _port_ to determine the server addresses.
        
      1014. 
      
        
    1014. 
          
          
            #
        
      1015. 
      
        
    1015. 
          
          
            # The _msg_ is a string.
        
      1016. 
      
        
    1016. 
          
          
            #
        
      1017. 
      
        
    1017. 
          
          
            # The _msg_src_ is a Socket::UDPSource object.
        
      1018. 
      
        
    1018. 
          
          
            # It is used for reply.
        
      1019. 
      
        
    1019. 
          
          
            #
        
      1020. 
      
        
    1020. 
          
          
            #   # UDP/IP echo server.
        
      1021. 
      
        
    1021. 
          
          
            #   Socket.udp_server_loop(9261) {|msg, msg_src|
        
      1022. 
      
        
    1022. 
          
          
            #     msg_src.reply msg
        
      1023. 
      
        
    1023. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      1024. 
      
        
    1024. 
          
          
            #
        
      1025. 
      
        
    1025. 
          1
          
            def self.udp_server_loop(host=nil, port, &b) # :yield: message, message_source
        
      1026. 
      
        
    1026. 
          
          
              udp_server_sockets(host, port) {|sockets|
        
      1027. 
      
        
    1027. 
          
          
                udp_server_loop_on(sockets, &b)
        
      1028. 
      
        
    1028. 
          
          
              }
        
      1029. 
      
        
    1029. 
          
          
            end
        
      1030. 
      
        
    1030. 
          
          
          
        
      1031. 
      
        
    1031. 
          
          
            # UDP/IP address information used by Socket.udp_server_loop.
        
      1032. 
      
        
    1032. 
          1
          
            class UDPSource
        
      1033. 
      
        
    1033. 
          
          
              # +remote_address+ is an Addrinfo object.
        
      1034. 
      
        
    1034. 
          
          
              #
        
      1035. 
      
        
    1035. 
          
          
              # +local_address+ is an Addrinfo object.
        
      1036. 
      
        
    1036. 
          
          
              #
        
      1037. 
      
        
    1037. 
          
          
              # +reply_proc+ is a Proc used to send reply back to the source.
        
      1038. 
      
        
    1038. 
          1
          
              def initialize(remote_address, local_address, &reply_proc)
        
      1039. 
      
        
    1039. 
          
          
                @remote_address = remote_address
        
      1040. 
      
        
    1040. 
          
          
                @local_address = local_address
        
      1041. 
      
        
    1041. 
          
          
                @reply_proc = reply_proc
        
      1042. 
      
        
    1042. 
          
          
              end
        
      1043. 
      
        
    1043. 
          
          
          
        
      1044. 
      
        
    1044. 
          
          
              # Address of the source
        
      1045. 
      
        
    1045. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :remote_address
        
      1046. 
      
        
    1046. 
          
          
          
        
      1047. 
      
        
    1047. 
          
          
              # Local address
        
      1048. 
      
        
    1048. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :local_address
        
      1049. 
      
        
    1049. 
          
          
          
        
      1050. 
      
        
    1050. 
          1
          
              def inspect # :nodoc:
        
      1051. 
      
        
    1051. 
          
          
                "\#<#{self.class}: #{@remote_address.inspect_sockaddr} to #{@local_address.inspect_sockaddr}>".dup
        
      1052. 
      
        
    1052. 
          
          
              end
        
      1053. 
      
        
    1053. 
          
          
          
        
      1054. 
      
        
    1054. 
          
          
              # Sends the String +msg+ to the source
        
      1055. 
      
        
    1055. 
          1
          
              def reply(msg)
        
      1056. 
      
        
    1056. 
          
          
                @reply_proc.call msg
        
      1057. 
      
        
    1057. 
          
          
              end
        
      1058. 
      
        
    1058. 
          
          
            end
        
      1059. 
      
        
    1059. 
          
          
          
        
      1060. 
      
        
    1060. 
          
          
            # creates a new socket connected to path using UNIX socket socket.
        
      1061. 
      
        
    1061. 
          
          
            #
        
      1062. 
      
        
    1062. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, the block is called with the socket.
        
      1063. 
      
        
    1063. 
          
          
            # The value of the block is returned.
        
      1064. 
      
        
    1064. 
          
          
            # The socket is closed when this method returns.
        
      1065. 
      
        
    1065. 
          
          
            #
        
      1066. 
      
        
    1066. 
          
          
            # If no block is given, the socket is returned.
        
      1067. 
      
        
    1067. 
          
          
            #
        
      1068. 
      
        
    1068. 
          
          
            #   # talk to /tmp/sock socket.
        
      1069. 
      
        
    1069. 
          
          
            #   Socket.unix("/tmp/sock") {|sock|
        
      1070. 
      
        
    1070. 
          
          
            #     t = Thread.new { IO.copy_stream(sock, STDOUT) }
        
      1071. 
      
        
    1071. 
          
          
            #     IO.copy_stream(STDIN, sock)
        
      1072. 
      
        
    1072. 
          
          
            #     t.join
        
      1073. 
      
        
    1073. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      1074. 
      
        
    1074. 
          
          
            #
        
      1075. 
      
        
    1075. 
          1
          
            def self.unix(path) # :yield: socket
        
      1076. 
      
        
    1076. 
          
          
              addr = Addrinfo.unix(path)
        
      1077. 
      
        
    1077. 
          
          
              sock = addr.connect
        
      1078. 
      
        
    1078. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      1079. 
      
        
    1079. 
          
          
                begin
        
      1080. 
      
        
    1080. 
          
          
                  yield sock
        
      1081. 
      
        
    1081. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      1082. 
      
        
    1082. 
          
          
                  sock.close
        
      1083. 
      
        
    1083. 
          
          
                end
        
      1084. 
      
        
    1084. 
          
          
              else
        
      1085. 
      
        
    1085. 
          
          
                sock
        
      1086. 
      
        
    1086. 
          
          
              end
        
      1087. 
      
        
    1087. 
          
          
            end
        
      1088. 
      
        
    1088. 
          
          
          
        
      1089. 
      
        
    1089. 
          
          
            # creates a UNIX server socket on _path_
        
      1090. 
      
        
    1090. 
          
          
            #
        
      1091. 
      
        
    1091. 
          
          
            # If no block given, it returns a listening socket.
        
      1092. 
      
        
    1092. 
          
          
            #
        
      1093. 
      
        
    1093. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, it is called with the socket and the block value is returned.
        
      1094. 
      
        
    1094. 
          
          
            # When the block exits, the socket is closed and the socket file is removed.
        
      1095. 
      
        
    1095. 
          
          
            #
        
      1096. 
      
        
    1096. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.unix_server_socket("/tmp/s")
        
      1097. 
      
        
    1097. 
          
          
            #   p socket                  #=> #<Socket:fd 3>
        
      1098. 
      
        
    1098. 
          
          
            #   p socket.local_address    #=> #<Addrinfo: /tmp/s SOCK_STREAM>
        
      1099. 
      
        
    1099. 
          
          
            #
        
      1100. 
      
        
    1100. 
          
          
            #   Socket.unix_server_socket("/tmp/sock") {|s|
        
      1101. 
      
        
    1101. 
          
          
            #     p s                     #=> #<Socket:fd 3>
        
      1102. 
      
        
    1102. 
          
          
            #     p s.local_address       #=> # #<Addrinfo: /tmp/sock SOCK_STREAM>
        
      1103. 
      
        
    1103. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      1104. 
      
        
    1104. 
          
          
            #
        
      1105. 
      
        
    1105. 
          1
          
            def self.unix_server_socket(path)
        
      1106. 
      
        
    1106. 
          
          
              unless unix_socket_abstract_name?(path)
        
      1107. 
      
        
    1107. 
          
          
                begin
        
      1108. 
      
        
    1108. 
          
          
                  st = File.lstat(path)
        
      1109. 
      
        
    1109. 
          
          
                rescue Errno::ENOENT
        
      1110. 
      
        
    1110. 
          
          
                end
        
      1111. 
      
        
    1111. 
          
          
                if st&.socket? && st.owned?
        
      1112. 
      
        
    1112. 
          
          
                  File.unlink path
        
      1113. 
      
        
    1113. 
          
          
                end
        
      1114. 
      
        
    1114. 
          
          
              end
        
      1115. 
      
        
    1115. 
          
          
              s = Addrinfo.unix(path).listen
        
      1116. 
      
        
    1116. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      1117. 
      
        
    1117. 
          
          
                begin
        
      1118. 
      
        
    1118. 
          
          
                  yield s
        
      1119. 
      
        
    1119. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      1120. 
      
        
    1120. 
          
          
                  s.close
        
      1121. 
      
        
    1121. 
          
          
                  unless unix_socket_abstract_name?(path)
        
      1122. 
      
        
    1122. 
          
          
                    File.unlink path
        
      1123. 
      
        
    1123. 
          
          
                  end
        
      1124. 
      
        
    1124. 
          
          
                end
        
      1125. 
      
        
    1125. 
          
          
              else
        
      1126. 
      
        
    1126. 
          
          
                s
        
      1127. 
      
        
    1127. 
          
          
              end
        
      1128. 
      
        
    1128. 
          
          
            end
        
      1129. 
      
        
    1129. 
          
          
          
        
      1130. 
      
        
    1130. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      1131. 
      
        
    1131. 
          1
          
              private
        
      1132. 
      
        
    1132. 
          
          
          
        
      1133. 
      
        
    1133. 
          1
          
              def unix_socket_abstract_name?(path)
        
      1134. 
      
        
    1134. 
          
          
                /linux/ =~ RUBY_PLATFORM && /\A(\0|\z)/ =~ path
        
      1135. 
      
        
    1135. 
          
          
              end
        
      1136. 
      
        
    1136. 
          
          
            end
        
      1137. 
      
        
    1137. 
          
          
          
        
      1138. 
      
        
    1138. 
          
          
            # creates a UNIX socket server on _path_.
        
      1139. 
      
        
    1139. 
          
          
            # It calls the block for each socket accepted.
        
      1140. 
      
        
    1140. 
          
          
            #
        
      1141. 
      
        
    1141. 
          
          
            # If _host_ is specified, it is used with _port_ to determine the server ports.
        
      1142. 
      
        
    1142. 
          
          
            #
        
      1143. 
      
        
    1143. 
          
          
            # The socket is *not* closed when the block returns.
        
      1144. 
      
        
    1144. 
          
          
            # So application should close it.
        
      1145. 
      
        
    1145. 
          
          
            #
        
      1146. 
      
        
    1146. 
          
          
            # This method deletes the socket file pointed by _path_ at first if
        
      1147. 
      
        
    1147. 
          
          
            # the file is a socket file and it is owned by the user of the application.
        
      1148. 
      
        
    1148. 
          
          
            # This is safe only if the directory of _path_ is not changed by a malicious user.
        
      1149. 
      
        
    1149. 
          
          
            # So don't use /tmp/malicious-users-directory/socket.
        
      1150. 
      
        
    1150. 
          
          
            # Note that /tmp/socket and /tmp/your-private-directory/socket is safe assuming that /tmp has sticky bit.
        
      1151. 
      
        
    1151. 
          
          
            #
        
      1152. 
      
        
    1152. 
          
          
            #   # Sequential echo server.
        
      1153. 
      
        
    1153. 
          
          
            #   # It services only one client at a time.
        
      1154. 
      
        
    1154. 
          
          
            #   Socket.unix_server_loop("/tmp/sock") {|sock, client_addrinfo|
        
      1155. 
      
        
    1155. 
          
          
            #     begin
        
      1156. 
      
        
    1156. 
          
          
            #       IO.copy_stream(sock, sock)
        
      1157. 
      
        
    1157. 
          
          
            #     ensure
        
      1158. 
      
        
    1158. 
          
          
            #       sock.close
        
      1159. 
      
        
    1159. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      1160. 
      
        
    1160. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      1161. 
      
        
    1161. 
          
          
            #
        
      1162. 
      
        
    1162. 
          1
          
            def self.unix_server_loop(path, &b) # :yield: socket, client_addrinfo
        
      1163. 
      
        
    1163. 
          
          
              unix_server_socket(path) {|serv|
        
      1164. 
      
        
    1164. 
          
          
                accept_loop(serv, &b)
        
      1165. 
      
        
    1165. 
          
          
              }
        
      1166. 
      
        
    1166. 
          
          
            end
        
      1167. 
      
        
    1167. 
          
          
          
        
      1168. 
      
        
    1168. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      1169. 
      
        
    1169. 
          
          
            #   socket.connect_nonblock(remote_sockaddr, [options]) => 0
        
      1170. 
      
        
    1170. 
          
          
            #
        
      1171. 
      
        
    1171. 
          
          
            # Requests a connection to be made on the given +remote_sockaddr+ after
        
      1172. 
      
        
    1172. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      1173. 
      
        
    1173. 
          
          
            # Returns 0 if successful, otherwise an exception is raised.
        
      1174. 
      
        
    1174. 
          
          
            #
        
      1175. 
      
        
    1175. 
          
          
            # === Parameter
        
      1176. 
      
        
    1176. 
          
          
            #  # +remote_sockaddr+ - the +struct+ sockaddr contained in a string or Addrinfo object
        
      1177. 
      
        
    1177. 
          
          
            #
        
      1178. 
      
        
    1178. 
          
          
            # === Example:
        
      1179. 
      
        
    1179. 
          
          
            #   # Pull down Google's web page
        
      1180. 
      
        
    1180. 
          
          
            #   require 'socket'
        
      1181. 
      
        
    1181. 
          
          
            #   include Socket::Constants
        
      1182. 
      
        
    1182. 
          
          
            #   socket = Socket.new(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)
        
      1183. 
      
        
    1183. 
          
          
            #   sockaddr = Socket.sockaddr_in(80, 'www.google.com')
        
      1184. 
      
        
    1184. 
          
          
            #   begin # emulate blocking connect
        
      1185. 
      
        
    1185. 
          
          
            #     socket.connect_nonblock(sockaddr)
        
      1186. 
      
        
    1186. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitWritable
        
      1187. 
      
        
    1187. 
          
          
            #     IO.select(nil, [socket]) # wait 3-way handshake completion
        
      1188. 
      
        
    1188. 
          
          
            #     begin
        
      1189. 
      
        
    1189. 
          
          
            #       socket.connect_nonblock(sockaddr) # check connection failure
        
      1190. 
      
        
    1190. 
          
          
            #     rescue Errno::EISCONN
        
      1191. 
      
        
    1191. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      1192. 
      
        
    1192. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      1193. 
      
        
    1193. 
          
          
            #   socket.write("GET / HTTP/1.0\r\n\r\n")
        
      1194. 
      
        
    1194. 
          
          
            #   results = socket.read
        
      1195. 
      
        
    1195. 
          
          
            #
        
      1196. 
      
        
    1196. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#connect for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      1197. 
      
        
    1197. 
          
          
            # to _connect_nonblock_ fails.
        
      1198. 
      
        
    1198. 
          
          
            #
        
      1199. 
      
        
    1199. 
          
          
            # Socket#connect_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to connect(2) failure,
        
      1200. 
      
        
    1200. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EINPROGRESS.
        
      1201. 
      
        
    1201. 
          
          
            #
        
      1202. 
      
        
    1202. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EINPROGRESS,
        
      1203. 
      
        
    1203. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitWritable.
        
      1204. 
      
        
    1204. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitWritable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying connect_nonblock.
        
      1205. 
      
        
    1205. 
          
          
            #
        
      1206. 
      
        
    1206. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      1207. 
      
        
    1207. 
          
          
            # that connect_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitWritable exception, but
        
      1208. 
      
        
    1208. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_writable+ instead.
        
      1209. 
      
        
    1209. 
          
          
            #
        
      1210. 
      
        
    1210. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      1211. 
      
        
    1211. 
          
          
            #  # Socket#connect
        
      1212. 
      
        
    1212. 
          1
          
            def connect_nonblock(addr, exception: true)
        
      1213. 
      
        
    1213. 
          
          
              __connect_nonblock(addr, exception)
        
      1214. 
      
        
    1214. 
          
          
            end
        
      1215. 
      
        
    1215. 
          
          
          end
        
      1216. 
      
        
    1216. 
          
          
          
        
      1217. 
      
        
    1217. 
          1
          
          class UDPSocket < IPSocket
        
      1218. 
      
        
    1218. 
          
          
          
        
      1219. 
      
        
    1219. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      1220. 
      
        
    1220. 
          
          
            #   udpsocket.recvfrom_nonblock(maxlen [, flags[, outbuf [, options]]]) => [mesg, sender_inet_addr]
        
      1221. 
      
        
    1221. 
          
          
            #
        
      1222. 
      
        
    1222. 
          
          
            # Receives up to _maxlen_ bytes from +udpsocket+ using recvfrom(2) after
        
      1223. 
      
        
    1223. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      1224. 
      
        
    1224. 
          
          
            # _flags_ is zero or more of the +MSG_+ options.
        
      1225. 
      
        
    1225. 
          
          
            # The first element of the results, _mesg_, is the data received.
        
      1226. 
      
        
    1226. 
          
          
            # The second element, _sender_inet_addr_, is an array to represent the sender address.
        
      1227. 
      
        
    1227. 
          
          
            #
        
      1228. 
      
        
    1228. 
          
          
            # When recvfrom(2) returns 0,
        
      1229. 
      
        
    1229. 
          
          
            # Socket#recvfrom_nonblock returns an empty string as data.
        
      1230. 
      
        
    1230. 
          
          
            # It means an empty packet.
        
      1231. 
      
        
    1231. 
          
          
            #
        
      1232. 
      
        
    1232. 
          
          
            # === Parameters
        
      1233. 
      
        
    1233. 
          
          
            # * +maxlen+ - the number of bytes to receive from the socket
        
      1234. 
      
        
    1234. 
          
          
            # * +flags+ - zero or more of the +MSG_+ options
        
      1235. 
      
        
    1235. 
          
          
            # * +outbuf+ - destination String buffer
        
      1236. 
      
        
    1236. 
          
          
            # * +options+ - keyword hash, supporting `exception: false`
        
      1237. 
      
        
    1237. 
          
          
            #
        
      1238. 
      
        
    1238. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      1239. 
      
        
    1239. 
          
          
            # 	require 'socket'
        
      1240. 
      
        
    1240. 
          
          
            # 	s1 = UDPSocket.new
        
      1241. 
      
        
    1241. 
          
          
            # 	s1.bind("127.0.0.1", 0)
        
      1242. 
      
        
    1242. 
          
          
            # 	s2 = UDPSocket.new
        
      1243. 
      
        
    1243. 
          
          
            # 	s2.bind("127.0.0.1", 0)
        
      1244. 
      
        
    1244. 
          
          
            # 	s2.connect(*s1.addr.values_at(3,1))
        
      1245. 
      
        
    1245. 
          
          
            # 	s1.connect(*s2.addr.values_at(3,1))
        
      1246. 
      
        
    1246. 
          
          
            # 	s1.send "aaa", 0
        
      1247. 
      
        
    1247. 
          
          
            # 	begin # emulate blocking recvfrom
        
      1248. 
      
        
    1248. 
          
          
            # 	  p s2.recvfrom_nonblock(10)  #=> ["aaa", ["AF_INET", 33302, "localhost.localdomain", "127.0.0.1"]]
        
      1249. 
      
        
    1249. 
          
          
            # 	rescue IO::WaitReadable
        
      1250. 
      
        
    1250. 
          
          
            # 	  IO.select([s2])
        
      1251. 
      
        
    1251. 
          
          
            # 	  retry
        
      1252. 
      
        
    1252. 
          
          
            # 	end
        
      1253. 
      
        
    1253. 
          
          
            #
        
      1254. 
      
        
    1254. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#recvfrom for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      1255. 
      
        
    1255. 
          
          
            # to _recvfrom_nonblock_ fails.
        
      1256. 
      
        
    1256. 
          
          
            #
        
      1257. 
      
        
    1257. 
          
          
            # UDPSocket#recvfrom_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to recvfrom(2) failure,
        
      1258. 
      
        
    1258. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      1259. 
      
        
    1259. 
          
          
            #
        
      1260. 
      
        
    1260. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK or Errno::EAGAIN,
        
      1261. 
      
        
    1261. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      1262. 
      
        
    1262. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying recvfrom_nonblock.
        
      1263. 
      
        
    1263. 
          
          
            #
        
      1264. 
      
        
    1264. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      1265. 
      
        
    1265. 
          
          
            # that recvfrom_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      1266. 
      
        
    1266. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      1267. 
      
        
    1267. 
          
          
            #
