      1268. 
      
        
    1268. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      1269. 
      
        
    1269. 
          
          
            # * Socket#recvfrom
        
      1270. 
      
        
    1270. 
          1
          
            def recvfrom_nonblock(len, flag = 0, outbuf = nil, exception: true)
        
      1271. 
      
        
    1271. 
          
          
              __recvfrom_nonblock(len, flag, outbuf, exception)
        
      1272. 
      
        
    1272. 
          
          
            end
        
      1273. 
      
        
    1273. 
          
          
          end
        
      1274. 
      
        
    1274. 
          
          
          
        
      1275. 
      
        
    1275. 
          1
          
          class TCPServer < TCPSocket
        
      1276. 
      
        
    1276. 
          
          
          
        
      1277. 
      
        
    1277. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      1278. 
      
        
    1278. 
          
          
            #   tcpserver.accept_nonblock([options]) => tcpsocket
        
      1279. 
      
        
    1279. 
          
          
            #
        
      1280. 
      
        
    1280. 
          
          
            # Accepts an incoming connection using accept(2) after
        
      1281. 
      
        
    1281. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      1282. 
      
        
    1282. 
          
          
            # It returns an accepted TCPSocket for the incoming connection.
        
      1283. 
      
        
    1283. 
          
          
            #
        
      1284. 
      
        
    1284. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      1285. 
      
        
    1285. 
          
          
            # 	require 'socket'
        
      1286. 
      
        
    1286. 
          
          
            # 	serv = TCPServer.new(2202)
        
      1287. 
      
        
    1287. 
          
          
            # 	begin # emulate blocking accept
        
      1288. 
      
        
    1288. 
          
          
            # 	  sock = serv.accept_nonblock
        
      1289. 
      
        
    1289. 
          
          
            # 	rescue IO::WaitReadable, Errno::EINTR
        
      1290. 
      
        
    1290. 
          
          
            # 	  IO.select([serv])
        
      1291. 
      
        
    1291. 
          
          
            # 	  retry
        
      1292. 
      
        
    1292. 
          
          
            # 	end
        
      1293. 
      
        
    1293. 
          
          
            # 	# sock is an accepted socket.
        
      1294. 
      
        
    1294. 
          
          
            #
        
      1295. 
      
        
    1295. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#accept for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      1296. 
      
        
    1296. 
          
          
            # to TCPServer#accept_nonblock fails.
        
      1297. 
      
        
    1297. 
          
          
            #
        
      1298. 
      
        
    1298. 
          
          
            # TCPServer#accept_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to accept(2) failure,
        
      1299. 
      
        
    1299. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      1300. 
      
        
    1300. 
          
          
            #
        
      1301. 
      
        
    1301. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK, Errno::EAGAIN, Errno::ECONNABORTED, Errno::EPROTO,
        
      1302. 
      
        
    1302. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      1303. 
      
        
    1303. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying accept_nonblock.
        
      1304. 
      
        
    1304. 
          
          
            #
        
      1305. 
      
        
    1305. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      1306. 
      
        
    1306. 
          
          
            # that accept_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      1307. 
      
        
    1307. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      1308. 
      
        
    1308. 
          
          
            #
        
      1309. 
      
        
    1309. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      1310. 
      
        
    1310. 
          
          
            # * TCPServer#accept
        
      1311. 
      
        
    1311. 
          
          
            # * Socket#accept
        
      1312. 
      
        
    1312. 
          1
          
            def accept_nonblock(exception: true)
        
      1313. 
      
        
    1313. 
          
          
              __accept_nonblock(exception)
        
      1314. 
      
        
    1314. 
          
          
            end
        
      1315. 
      
        
    1315. 
          
          
          end
        
      1316. 
      
        
    1316. 
          
          
          
        
      1317. 
      
        
    1317. 
          
          
          class UNIXServer < UNIXSocket
        
      1318. 
      
        
    1318. 
          
          
            # call-seq:
        
      1319. 
      
        
    1319. 
          
          
            #   unixserver.accept_nonblock([options]) => unixsocket
        
      1320. 
      
        
    1320. 
          
          
            #
        
      1321. 
      
        
    1321. 
          
          
            # Accepts an incoming connection using accept(2) after
        
      1322. 
      
        
    1322. 
          
          
            # O_NONBLOCK is set for the underlying file descriptor.
        
      1323. 
      
        
    1323. 
          
          
            # It returns an accepted UNIXSocket for the incoming connection.
        
      1324. 
      
        
    1324. 
          
          
            #
        
      1325. 
      
        
    1325. 
          
          
            # === Example
        
      1326. 
      
        
    1326. 
          
          
            # 	require 'socket'
        
      1327. 
      
        
    1327. 
          
          
            # 	serv = UNIXServer.new("/tmp/sock")
        
      1328. 
      
        
    1328. 
          
          
            # 	begin # emulate blocking accept
        
      1329. 
      
        
    1329. 
          
          
            # 	  sock = serv.accept_nonblock
        
      1330. 
      
        
    1330. 
          
          
            # 	rescue IO::WaitReadable, Errno::EINTR
        
      1331. 
      
        
    1331. 
          
          
            # 	  IO.select([serv])
        
      1332. 
      
        
    1332. 
          
          
            # 	  retry
        
      1333. 
      
        
    1333. 
          
          
            # 	end
        
      1334. 
      
        
    1334. 
          
          
            # 	# sock is an accepted socket.
        
      1335. 
      
        
    1335. 
          
          
            #
        
      1336. 
      
        
    1336. 
          
          
            # Refer to Socket#accept for the exceptions that may be thrown if the call
        
      1337. 
      
        
    1337. 
          
          
            # to UNIXServer#accept_nonblock fails.
        
      1338. 
      
        
    1338. 
          
          
            #
        
      1339. 
      
        
    1339. 
          
          
            # UNIXServer#accept_nonblock may raise any error corresponding to accept(2) failure,
        
      1340. 
      
        
    1340. 
          
          
            # including Errno::EWOULDBLOCK.
        
      1341. 
      
        
    1341. 
          
          
            #
        
      1342. 
      
        
    1342. 
          
          
            # If the exception is Errno::EWOULDBLOCK, Errno::EAGAIN, Errno::ECONNABORTED or Errno::EPROTO,
        
      1343. 
      
        
    1343. 
          
          
            # it is extended by IO::WaitReadable.
        
      1344. 
      
        
    1344. 
          
          
            # So IO::WaitReadable can be used to rescue the exceptions for retrying accept_nonblock.
        
      1345. 
      
        
    1345. 
          
          
            #
        
      1346. 
      
        
    1346. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      1347. 
      
        
    1347. 
          
          
            # that accept_nonblock should not raise an IO::WaitReadable exception, but
        
      1348. 
      
        
    1348. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      1349. 
      
        
    1349. 
          
          
            #
        
      1350. 
      
        
    1350. 
          
          
            # === See
        
      1351. 
      
        
    1351. 
          
          
            # * UNIXServer#accept
        
      1352. 
      
        
    1352. 
          
          
            # * Socket#accept
        
      1353. 
      
        
    1353. 
          1
          
            def accept_nonblock(exception: true)
        
      1354. 
      
        
    1354. 
          
          
              __accept_nonblock(exception)
        
      1355. 
      
        
    1355. 
          
          
            end
        
      1356. 
      
        
    1356. 
          1
          
          end if defined?(UNIXSocket)
        
      1357.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/tempfile.rb

    27.63 % covered

    76 relevant lines. 21 lines covered and 55 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # tempfile - manipulates temporary files
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # $Id: tempfile.rb 66415 2018-12-16 12:09:08Z nobu $
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
          require 'delegate'
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
          require 'tmpdir'
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # A utility class for managing temporary files. When you create a Tempfile
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          # object, it will create a temporary file with a unique filename. A Tempfile
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # objects behaves just like a File object, and you can perform all the usual
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          # file operations on it: reading data, writing data, changing its permissions,
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # etc. So although this class does not explicitly document all instance methods
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # supported by File, you can in fact call any File instance method on a
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # Tempfile object.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          # == Synopsis
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #   require 'tempfile'
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          #
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #   file = Tempfile.new('foo')
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #   file.path      # => A unique filename in the OS's temp directory,
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #                  #    e.g.: "/tmp/foo.24722.0"
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #                  #    This filename contains 'foo' in its basename.
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          #   file.write("hello world")
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          #   file.rewind
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          #   file.read      # => "hello world"
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #   file.close
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #   file.unlink    # deletes the temp file
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          # == Good practices
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          # === Explicit close
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          # When a Tempfile object is garbage collected, or when the Ruby interpreter
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          # exits, its associated temporary file is automatically deleted. This means
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          # that's it's unnecessary to explicitly delete a Tempfile after use, though
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          # it's good practice to do so: not explicitly deleting unused Tempfiles can
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          # potentially leave behind large amounts of tempfiles on the filesystem
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          # until they're garbage collected. The existence of these temp files can make
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          # it harder to determine a new Tempfile filename.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          # Therefore, one should always call #unlink or close in an ensure block, like
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          # this:
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          #   file = Tempfile.new('foo')
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          #   begin
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          #      # ...do something with file...
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          #   ensure
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          #      file.close
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          #      file.unlink   # deletes the temp file
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          #
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          # === Unlink after creation
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          #
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          # On POSIX systems, it's possible to unlink a file right after creating it,
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          # and before closing it. This removes the filesystem entry without closing
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          # the file handle, so it ensures that only the processes that already had
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          # the file handle open can access the file's contents. It's strongly
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
          # recommended that you do this if you do not want any other processes to
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          # be able to read from or write to the Tempfile, and you do not need to
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          # know the Tempfile's filename either.
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          #
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          # For example, a practical use case for unlink-after-creation would be this:
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          # you need a large byte buffer that's too large to comfortably fit in RAM,
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
          # e.g. when you're writing a web server and you want to buffer the client's
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
          # file upload data.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          #
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          # Please refer to #unlink for more information and a code example.
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          #
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          # == Minor notes
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          #
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          # Tempfile's filename picking method is both thread-safe and inter-process-safe:
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          # it guarantees that no other threads or processes will pick the same filename.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          # Tempfile itself however may not be entirely thread-safe. If you access the
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          # same Tempfile object from multiple threads then you should protect it with a
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          # mutex.
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          1
          
          class Tempfile < DelegateClass(File)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # Creates a temporary file with permissions 0600 (= only readable and
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            # writable by the owner) and opens it with mode "w+".
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            # The +basename+ parameter is used to determine the name of the
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            # temporary file. You can either pass a String or an Array with
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
            # 2 String elements. In the former form, the temporary file's base
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            # name will begin with the given string. In the latter form,
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            # the temporary file's base name will begin with the array's first
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            # element, and end with the second element. For example:
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            #
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            #   file = Tempfile.new('hello')
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            #   file.path  # => something like: "/tmp/hello2843-8392-92849382--0"
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            #   # Use the Array form to enforce an extension in the filename:
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            #   file = Tempfile.new(['hello', '.jpg'])
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
            #   file.path  # => something like: "/tmp/hello2843-8392-92849382--0.jpg"
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            # The temporary file will be placed in the directory as specified
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
            # by the +tmpdir+ parameter. By default, this is +Dir.tmpdir+.
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            # When $SAFE > 0 and the given +tmpdir+ is tainted, it uses
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            # '/tmp' as the temporary directory. Please note that ENV values
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
            # are tainted by default, and +Dir.tmpdir+'s return value might
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            # come from environment variables (e.g. <tt>$TMPDIR</tt>).
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            #
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            #   file = Tempfile.new('hello', '/home/aisaka')
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            #   file.path  # => something like: "/home/aisaka/hello2843-8392-92849382--0"
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            #
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            # You can also pass an options hash. Under the hood, Tempfile creates
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            # the temporary file using +File.open+. These options will be passed to
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            # +File.open+. This is mostly useful for specifying encoding
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            # options, e.g.:
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
            #
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            #   Tempfile.new('hello', '/home/aisaka', encoding: 'ascii-8bit')
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            #
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            #   # You can also omit the 'tmpdir' parameter:
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            #   Tempfile.new('hello', encoding: 'ascii-8bit')
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
            #
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            # Note: +mode+ keyword argument, as accepted by Tempfile, can only be
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            # numeric, combination of the modes defined in File::Constants.
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            #
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            # === Exceptions
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            #
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            # If Tempfile.new cannot find a unique filename within a limited
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            # number of tries, then it will raise an exception.
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          1
          
            def initialize(basename="", tmpdir=nil, mode: 0, **options)
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              warn "Tempfile.new doesn't call the given block.", uplevel: 1 if block_given?
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              @unlinked = false
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              @mode = mode|File::RDWR|File::CREAT|File::EXCL
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              ::Dir::Tmpname.create(basename, tmpdir, options) do |tmpname, n, opts|
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                opts[:perm] = 0600
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                @tmpfile = File.open(tmpname, @mode, opts)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                @opts = opts.freeze
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              end
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
              ObjectSpace.define_finalizer(self, Remover.new(@tmpfile))
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              super(@tmpfile)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
            end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            # Opens or reopens the file with mode "r+".
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          1
          
            def open
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              _close
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
              mode = @mode & ~(File::CREAT|File::EXCL)
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              @tmpfile = File.open(@tmpfile.path, mode, @opts)
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              __setobj__(@tmpfile)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            end
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
            def _close    # :nodoc:
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              @tmpfile.close
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            end
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          1
          
            protected :_close
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            # Closes the file. If +unlink_now+ is true, then the file will be unlinked
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            # (deleted) after closing. Of course, you can choose to later call #unlink
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            # if you do not unlink it now.
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            #
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            # If you don't explicitly unlink the temporary file, the removal
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
            # will be delayed until the object is finalized.
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          1
          
            def close(unlink_now=false)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              _close
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
              unlink if unlink_now
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            end
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            # Closes and unlinks (deletes) the file. Has the same effect as called
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            # <tt>close(true)</tt>.
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
            def close!
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              close(true)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            # Unlinks (deletes) the file from the filesystem. One should always unlink
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            # the file after using it, as is explained in the "Explicit close" good
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            # practice section in the Tempfile overview:
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            #
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            #   file = Tempfile.new('foo')
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #   begin
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            #      # ...do something with file...
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            #   ensure
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            #      file.close
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            #      file.unlink   # deletes the temp file
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            #
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            # === Unlink-before-close
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
            #
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            # On POSIX systems it's possible to unlink a file before closing it. This
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            # practice is explained in detail in the Tempfile overview (section
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            # "Unlink after creation"); please refer there for more information.
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            #
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            # However, unlink-before-close may not be supported on non-POSIX operating
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            # systems. Microsoft Windows is the most notable case: unlinking a non-closed
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            # file will result in an error, which this method will silently ignore. If
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            # you want to practice unlink-before-close whenever possible, then you should
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            # write code like this:
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            #
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            #   file = Tempfile.new('foo')
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            #   file.unlink   # On Windows this silently fails.
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            #   begin
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            #      # ... do something with file ...
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            #   ensure
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            #      file.close!   # Closes the file handle. If the file wasn't unlinked
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            #                    # because #unlink failed, then this method will attempt
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            #                    # to do so again.
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          1
          
            def unlink
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              return if @unlinked
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              begin
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                File.unlink(@tmpfile.path)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::ENOENT
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::EACCES
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                # may not be able to unlink on Windows; just ignore
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                return
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              ObjectSpace.undefine_finalizer(self)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              @unlinked = true
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
            end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
            alias delete unlink
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            # Returns the full path name of the temporary file.
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            # This will be nil if #unlink has been called.
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          1
          
            def path
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              @unlinked ? nil : @tmpfile.path
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            end
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            # Returns the size of the temporary file.  As a side effect, the IO
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            # buffer is flushed before determining the size.
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          1
          
            def size
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              if !@tmpfile.closed?
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                @tmpfile.size # File#size calls rb_io_flush_raw()
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
              else
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                File.size(@tmpfile.path)
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          1
          
            alias length size
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            # :stopdoc:
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          1
          
            def inspect
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              if closed?
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class}:#{path} (closed)>"
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              else
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class}:#{path}>"
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              end
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            end
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          1
          
            class Remover # :nodoc:
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          1
          
              def initialize(tmpfile)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                @pid = Process.pid
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                @tmpfile = tmpfile
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
              end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          1
          
              def call(*args)
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                return if @pid != Process.pid
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
          
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                $stderr.puts "removing #{@tmpfile.path}..." if $DEBUG
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                @tmpfile.close
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                begin
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                  File.unlink(@tmpfile.path)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                rescue Errno::ENOENT
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                end
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
          
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                $stderr.puts "done" if $DEBUG
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
            end
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
          
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              # :startdoc:
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              # Creates a new Tempfile.
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              #
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              # If no block is given, this is a synonym for Tempfile.new.
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              #
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              # If a block is given, then a Tempfile object will be constructed,
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              # and the block is run with said object as argument. The Tempfile
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              # object will be automatically closed after the block terminates.
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
              # The call returns the value of the block.
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              #
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              # In any case, all arguments (<code>*args</code>) will be passed to Tempfile.new.
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              #
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              #   Tempfile.open('foo', '/home/temp') do |f|
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              #      # ... do something with f ...
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              #
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              #   # Equivalent:
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              #   f = Tempfile.open('foo', '/home/temp')
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              #   begin
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              #      # ... do something with f ...
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
              #   ensure
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              #      f.close
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          1
          
              def open(*args)
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                tempfile = new(*args)
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
          
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                if block_given?
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                    yield(tempfile)
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                  ensure
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                    tempfile.close
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                  end
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                else
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                  tempfile
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                end
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              end
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
            end
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
          # Creates a temporary file as usual File object (not Tempfile).
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          # It doesn't use finalizer and delegation.
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
          #
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
          # If no block is given, this is similar to Tempfile.new except
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          # creating File instead of Tempfile.
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
          # The created file is not removed automatically.
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
          # You should use File.unlink to remove it.
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
          #
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
          # If a block is given, then a File object will be constructed,
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
          # and the block is invoked with the object as the argument.
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          # The File object will be automatically closed and
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
          # the temporary file is removed after the block terminates.
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
          # The call returns the value of the block.
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
          #
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
          # In any case, all arguments (+basename+, +tmpdir+, +mode+, and
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
          # <code>**options</code>) will be treated as Tempfile.new.
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          #
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          #   Tempfile.create('foo', '/home/temp') do |f|
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
          #      # ... do something with f ...
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
          #
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          1
          
          def Tempfile.create(basename="", tmpdir=nil, mode: 0, **options)
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
            tmpfile = nil
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            Dir::Tmpname.create(basename, tmpdir, options) do |tmpname, n, opts|
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              mode |= File::RDWR|File::CREAT|File::EXCL
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              opts[:perm] = 0600
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              tmpfile = File.open(tmpname, mode, opts)
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
            end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            if block_given?
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
              begin
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                yield tmpfile
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              ensure
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                unless tmpfile.closed?
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  if File.identical?(tmpfile, tmpfile.path)
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                    unlinked = File.unlink tmpfile.path rescue nil
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                  end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                  tmpfile.close
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                end
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                unless unlinked
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                    File.unlink tmpfile.path
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
                  rescue Errno::ENOENT
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                  end
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                end
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
            else
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              tmpfile
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            end
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
          end
        
      355.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/timeout.rb

    63.04 % covered

    46 relevant lines. 29 lines covered and 17 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: false
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # Timeout long-running blocks
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          #
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # == Synopsis
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #   require 'timeout'
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #   status = Timeout::timeout(5) {
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          #     # Something that should be interrupted if it takes more than 5 seconds...
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #   }
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # == Description
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # Timeout provides a way to auto-terminate a potentially long-running
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          # operation if it hasn't finished in a fixed amount of time.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # Previous versions didn't use a module for namespacing, however
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # #timeout is provided for backwards compatibility.  You
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          # should prefer Timeout.timeout instead.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          # == Copyright
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          # Copyright:: (C) 2000  Network Applied Communication Laboratory, Inc.
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          # Copyright:: (C) 2000  Information-technology Promotion Agency, Japan
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          1
          
          module Timeout
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            # Raised by Timeout.timeout when the block times out.
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
            class Error < RuntimeError
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :thread
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
              def self.catch(*args)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                exc = new(*args)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                exc.instance_variable_set(:@thread, Thread.current)
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                ::Kernel.catch(exc) {yield exc}
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              end
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          1
          
              def exception(*)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                # TODO: use Fiber.current to see if self can be thrown
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                if self.thread == Thread.current
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  bt = caller
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                    throw(self, bt)
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  rescue UncaughtThrowError
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                  end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                self
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            end
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            # :stopdoc:
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
            THIS_FILE = /\A#{Regexp.quote(__FILE__)}:/o
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          1
          
            CALLER_OFFSET = ((c = caller[0]) && THIS_FILE =~ c) ? 1 : 0
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
            private_constant :THIS_FILE, :CALLER_OFFSET
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            # :startdoc:
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            # Perform an operation in a block, raising an error if it takes longer than
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            # +sec+ seconds to complete.
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            #
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            # +sec+:: Number of seconds to wait for the block to terminate. Any number
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #         may be used, including Floats to specify fractional seconds. A
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            #         value of 0 or +nil+ will execute the block without any timeout.
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            # +klass+:: Exception Class to raise if the block fails to terminate
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            #           in +sec+ seconds.  Omitting will use the default, Timeout::Error
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            # +message+:: Error message to raise with Exception Class.
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            #             Omitting will use the default, "execution expired"
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            #
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            # Returns the result of the block *if* the block completed before
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            # +sec+ seconds, otherwise throws an exception, based on the value of +klass+.
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            #
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # The exception thrown to terminate the given block cannot be rescued inside
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # the block unless +klass+ is given explicitly.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            #
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            # Note that this is both a method of module Timeout, so you can <tt>include
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            # Timeout</tt> into your classes so they have a #timeout method, as well as
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            # a module method, so you can call it directly as Timeout.timeout().
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          1
          
            def timeout(sec, klass = nil, message = nil)   #:yield: +sec+
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          57
          
              return yield(sec) if sec == nil or sec.zero?
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          57
          
              message ||= "execution expired".freeze
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          57
          
              from = "from #{caller_locations(1, 1)[0]}" if $DEBUG
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          57
          
              e = Error
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          57
          
              bl = proc do |exception|
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                begin
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          57
          
                  x = Thread.current
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          57
          
                  y = Thread.start {
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          57
          
                    Thread.current.name = from
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          57
          
                      sleep sec
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                    rescue => e
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                      x.raise e
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                    else
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                      x.raise exception, message
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                    end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                  }
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          57
          
                  return yield(sec)
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          57
          
                  if y
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          57
          
                    y.kill
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          57
          
                    y.join # make sure y is dead.
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                  end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          57
          
              if klass
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                begin
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          57
          
                  bl.call(klass)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                rescue klass => e
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  bt = e.backtrace
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
              else
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                bt = Error.catch(message, &bl)
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
              level = -caller(CALLER_OFFSET).size-2
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              while THIS_FILE =~ bt[level]
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                bt.delete_at(level)
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              raise(e, message, bt)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          1
          
            module_function :timeout
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          end
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          
        
      120.

      121.

            # Returns the operating system's temporary file path.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          
        
      21.

          1
          
            def self.tmpdir
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              if $SAFE > 0
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                @@systmpdir.dup
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              else
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                tmp = nil
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                [ENV['TMPDIR'], ENV['TMP'], ENV['TEMP'], @@systmpdir, '/tmp', '.'].each do |dir|
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  next if !dir
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  dir = File.expand_path(dir)
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  if stat = File.stat(dir) and stat.directory? and stat.writable? and
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                      (!stat.world_writable? or stat.sticky?)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                    tmp = dir
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                    break
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  end rescue nil
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                end

                raise ArgumentError, "could not find a temporary directory" unless tmp

                tmp

    38. 
          
          
            end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            # Dir.mktmpdir creates a temporary directory.
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            #
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            # The directory is created with 0700 permission.
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # Application should not change the permission to make the temporary directory accessible from other users.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # The prefix and suffix of the name of the directory is specified by
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # the optional first argument, <i>prefix_suffix</i>.
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            # - If it is not specified or nil, "d" is used as the prefix and no suffix is used.
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            # - If it is a string, it is used as the prefix and no suffix is used.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            # - If it is an array, first element is used as the prefix and second element is used as a suffix.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir {|dir| dir is ".../d..." }
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir("foo") {|dir| dir is ".../foo..." }
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir(["foo", "bar"]) {|dir| dir is ".../foo...bar" }
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            #
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            # The directory is created under Dir.tmpdir or
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            # the optional second argument <i>tmpdir</i> if non-nil value is given.
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            #
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir {|dir| dir is "#{Dir.tmpdir}/d..." }
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir(nil, "/var/tmp") {|dir| dir is "/var/tmp/d..." }
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            #
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            # If a block is given,
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            # it is yielded with the path of the directory.
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            # The directory and its contents are removed
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            # using FileUtils.remove_entry before Dir.mktmpdir returns.
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            # The value of the block is returned.
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            #
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            #  Dir.mktmpdir {|dir|
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            #    # use the directory...
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            #    open("#{dir}/foo", "w") { ... }
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            #  }
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            #
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            # If a block is not given,
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            # The path of the directory is returned.
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            # In this case, Dir.mktmpdir doesn't remove the directory.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            #  dir = Dir.mktmpdir
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            #  begin
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
            #    # use the directory...
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            #    open("#{dir}/foo", "w") { ... }
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            #  ensure
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            #    # remove the directory.
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            #    FileUtils.remove_entry dir
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #  end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          1
          
            def self.mktmpdir(prefix_suffix=nil, *rest)
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              base = nil
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              path = Tmpname.create(prefix_suffix || "d", *rest) {|path, _, _, d|
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                base = d
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                mkdir(path, 0700)
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
              }
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
              if block_given?
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                begin
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                  yield path
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  unless base
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                    stat = File.stat(File.dirname(path))
        
      97. 
      
        
    97.

              def tmpdir

                Dir.tmpdir

          1
          
              def create(basename, tmpdir=nil, max_try: nil, **opts)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                if $SAFE > 0 and tmpdir.tainted?
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  tmpdir = '/tmp'
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                else
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  origdir = tmpdir
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  tmpdir ||= tmpdir()
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                n = nil
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                prefix, suffix = basename
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                prefix = (String.try_convert(prefix) or
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                          raise ArgumentError, "unexpected prefix: #{prefix.inspect}")
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                prefix = prefix.delete("#{File::SEPARATOR}#{File::ALT_SEPARATOR}")
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                suffix &&= (String.try_convert(suffix) or
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                            raise ArgumentError, "unexpected suffix: #{suffix.inspect}")
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                suffix &&= suffix.delete("#{File::SEPARATOR}#{File::ALT_SEPARATOR}")
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                begin
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                  t = Time.now.strftime("%Y%m%d")
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  path = "#{prefix}#{t}-#{$$}-#{rand(0x100000000).to_s(36)}"\
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                         "#{n ? %[-#{n}] : ''}#{suffix||''}"
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                  path = File.join(tmpdir, path)
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  yield(path, n, opts, origdir)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                rescue Errno::EEXIST
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  n ||= 0
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                  n += 1
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  retry if !max_try or n < max_try
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  raise "cannot generate temporary name using `#{basename}' under `#{tmpdir}'"
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                end
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                path
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          end
        
      146.

      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            ##
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            # Reporter object to be used for all runs.
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # NOTE: This accessor is only available during setup, not during runs.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          1
          
            mc.send :attr_accessor, :reporter
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            ##
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            # Names of known extension plugins.
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
            mc.send :attr_accessor, :extensions
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            ##
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            # The signal to use for dumping information to STDERR. Defaults to "INFO".
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          1
          
            mc.send :attr_accessor, :info_signal
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
            self.info_signal = "INFO"
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            ##
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            # Registers Minitest to run at process exit
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
            def self.autorun
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              at_exit {
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          1
          
                next if $! and not ($!.kind_of? SystemExit and $!.success?)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
                exit_code = nil
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          1
          
                pid = Process.pid
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
                at_exit {
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1
          
                  next if Process.pid != pid
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          1
          
                  @@after_run.reverse_each(&:call)
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
                  exit exit_code || false
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                }
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          1
          
                exit_code = Minitest.run ARGV
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1
          
              } unless @@installed_at_exit
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
              @@installed_at_exit = true
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            ##
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            # A simple hook allowing you to run a block of code after everything
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            # is done running. Eg:
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            #
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            #   Minitest.after_run { p $debugging_info }
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1
          
            def self.after_run &block
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              @@after_run << block
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            end
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          1
          
            def self.init_plugins options # :nodoc:
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
              self.extensions.each do |name|
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          1
          
                msg = "plugin_#{name}_init"
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          1
          
                send msg, options if self.respond_to? msg
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              end
